loans.name: Savery's Group

texts.en:
Savery, 27, lives with family members in a rural village of Kandal province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and another one who is too young for school. To support her living, she works at a garment factory and also grows rice to get more income. For her work, she gets little income to support her living and it is her main challenge. She can save from her daily income about 30,000 KHR each day. She has been involved with her work for seven years.

This is the second cycle for Savery with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she wisely repaid her past loan. Since the previous loan, her family’s living is getting better than before. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her crop yields. She hopes to gain both more yields and qualified crops, so she can sell it at a high price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her crop yields.

loans.name: Alexis Arturo

texts.es:
Alexis es un joven estudiante que vive junto a sus tíos y primos. Su madre vive en la selva, ella se trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa, para poder apoyarlo en sus estudios, debido a que la cuota mensual de SENATI era accesible a su economía. Debido a que las mensualidades en SENATI subieron, su madre ya no pudo seguir apoyando a Alexis, lo que puso en riesgo su continuidad profesional.

Él se encuentra actualmente cursando el II Semestre de Redes de Computación y Comunicación de Datos, carrera que le gusta mucho porque se basa en implementar, gestionar, estructurar una red de computadoras; también se basa en administrar información y base de datos de las empresas. Él piensa especializarse en el área de Programación de Software.

Él recurre a KIVA solicitando este préstamo para que pueda continuar con sus estudios, ya que por ahora su madre no percibe muchos ingresos y tendría que dejar de estudiar para buscar un trabajo que le permita continuar con sus estudios, lo que retrasaría su desarrollo profesional.

Él se encuentra muy interesado en su carrera, porque siente que lo beneficiará económicamente y también le permitirá apoyar a su madre con la educación de su hermana menor.

Alexis está muy agradecido con KIVA por este apoyo que le están brindando y les quiere expresar unas palabras: "Muchas gracias KIVA por el apoyo que me están brindando, prometo esforzarme mucho para convertirme en un gran profesional y formar mi propia empresa. Gracias, muchas gracias KIVA!!
texts.en:
Alexis is a young student who lives with his aunts,  uncles and cousins. His mother lives in the jungle and works as a household employee to support him with his studies since the SENATI monthly fee fit into her budget. But because the SENATI monthly fees increased, Alexis' mother was no longer able to continue supporting him which put his professional development at risk. 

He is currently in the second semester of Computer Networks and Data Communication, a career that he likes very much because it is based on implementing, managing and structuring a computer network; it is also based on corporate data base management. Alexis plans on specializing in the area of Software Programming. 

He is turning to Kiva to ask for a loan so that he can continue with his studies since his mother is not earning very much. He would have to stop going to school and find work so he could continue with his studies. This would delay his professional development. He is very interested in his chosen career because he thinks it will benefit him financially and it would also allow him to help his mother pay for his younger sister's education. 

Alexis is very grateful to Kiva for the support he is receiving and wants to share a few words: "Many thanks, Kiva, for the support you are  providing.  I promise to work very hard to become a great professional and form my own company. Thanks, many thanks Kiva!"

loans.use: to pay for his Computer Networking studies and to form his own company in the not-too-distant future.

loans.name: Grupo Xejuyup Mujeres Lideres Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una joven de grandes sueños y propósitos en la vida ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus hermanos y padres en una comunidad de la aldea xejuyup Nahualá.
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto)  para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con el sustento de su familia, ella desde hace cinco años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella eligió esta actividad porque lamentablemente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, sin embargo ella tiene grandes ilusiones de tener uno de los negocios más reconocidos de su comunidad. A pesar de ser muy joven contagia su entusiasmo por superarse es por ello que es la líder de un grupo, ella busca un préstamo para poder realizar una inversión en su negocio de ropa, con el préstamo ella estará comprando cortes de tinta, güipiles de diferentes colores y estilos.
Catarina su mayor anhelo es contar con un local donde ella pueda instalar mejor sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Catarina is a young woman of great hopes and life objectives. She is 23 years old, single and lives with her siblings and parents in a community of the village Xejuyup Nahualá. Catarina is the first on the left side of the photo. In order to earn her income and support her parents, for five years she has worked buying and selling traditional clothing. She chose this activity, because unfortunately she did not have the opportunity to study. However, she has great illusion to have one of the better recognized businesses in her community. Even when she is very young, she transfers her enthusiasm for progress, and because of this reason, she is a group's leader. She is looking for a loan to invest in her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy handwoven cloths and güipiles (traditional tunics) in different colors and styles. Catarina's greatest desire is to have a store where she can show her products better and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing products such as: handwoven cloths and güipiles (traditional tunics).

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hija en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Lorenzo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.Además de ellos también cultiva plátano y yuca. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de cacao así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Lorenzo espera ofrecer un cacao de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 36, lives with his wife and daughter in their own house of rustic materials in the Pucara district which is found in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the mountains of northern Peru.  Life in this district is tranquil.  The inhabitants make a living primarily from agriculture, commerce and livestock raising.
Lorenzo makes his living from agriculture, specifically from cultivating cacao.  He has 10 years of experience in this line of work and very good work and personal references in the zone.  Aside from this, he also grows bananas and yuca.  The loan that will be offered him will be used to buy manure and fertilizers in order to have an adequate maintenance for his cacao crop as well as for contracting labor during the harvest season.  
With this, Lorenzo hopes to offer a better quality cacao to his customers which will have a positive impact on his level of income and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers in order to have adequate maintenance for his cacao crop as well as for contracting labor in the harvest season.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama OASIS cuenta con diecisiete integrantes, están en el 8vo ciclo, todas las mujeres de este grupo son muy emprendedoras., trabajadoras y luchadoras que luchan por poder salir adelante y por medio de sus trabajos poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Clara es muy guapa, desde tempranas horas del día ya sale a ofrecer riquísima sopa paraguaya preparadas por ella misma y que vende de manera ambulante. Está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar por medio de su emprendimiento que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer su sopa paraguaya que vende, como ser harina de maíz, huevo, manteca, cebollas y otros, y de esa manera poder continuar luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The committee's name is OASIS and it has seventeen members. They are in the 8th loan cycle and all of the women in this group are very entrepreneurial, hard-working and determined in striving to get ahead in life. Through their work they are able to help their loved ones.

Clara is very resolute. Early in the morning she goes out to sell a delicious Paraguayan soup that she makes herself, which she sells in the street. She is making every effort to grow and improve her business through her hard work.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make the Paraguayan soup she sells, such as corn meal, eggs, lard, onions and other products. In this she will be able to continue to strive for improvement.

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs, lard, onions and more.

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo de un año de edad, ambos dependen de los ingresos que genera don José, ellos no tienen ayuda económica del extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, siembra maíz y frijol, trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 10 años, tiene un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió de familia y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Con el crédito comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, para sembrar granos básicos, espera tener una cosecha abundante, para vender más producto y tener sostenibilidad económica para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar trabajando para que su negocio se mantenga con vida, mejorar su vivienda y darles los estudios superiores a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his family which is composed of his wife and a one-year-old son. They both depend on the income that Jose generates, and they receive no financial help from overseas.

His source of income is farming. He grows corn and beans and has been working independently for ten years. Jose works from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m. and learned his trade from his family, and up to now he has had no difficulties with it. 

He will use the money from the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides to grow basic grains. He hopes to have an abundant harvest so he can sell more product, support his family financially and get ahead. 

His aspirations are to  continue working so his business thrives, to fix up his house, and to provide his children with higher education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides so he can grow basic grains and have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es feliz mente casa con una linda familia, ella cuenta que a Dios gracias con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien porque pudo comprar su refrigeradora con el que ahora conservar sus productos para poder venderlos más fresco, con esta superación sus ingresos han mejorado, pero ella ahora ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de jocotes y aguacates, pues Margarita espera contar nuevamente con su apoyo para seguir superándose y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Margarita is a 34 year old woman. She is happily married and has a beautiful family. She comments, that thanks God she did very well with the previous loan, because she was able to buy a refrigerator which she now uses to keep her products and be able to sell them fresher. With this progress, her income has improved; but now she has made the decision to get a new loan to buy and sell jocotes (Spanish plums) and avocados. Margarita hopes to have your support again in order to continue progressing, to give her family a better quality of life and that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy and sell jocotes (Spanish plums) and avocados.

loans.name: Liem

texts.en:
Liem, 33, is a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the other one is not yet school age. She lives in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, where the rice and cassava have been grown for years. Besides these, she and her husband are raising chickens and working for others for a fee to supplement their income. These businesses earn this family only about 35,000 KHR per day. The family’s finances have decreased slightly since the chickens got ill and the rice crops were destroyed by pests. Now, Liem is asking for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to save the farming business.

This is her third loan and her past loan was repaid successfully. It has enabled her to improve her living conditions. With this new loan, Liem will pay for the plowing and paid worker’s fees and to buy seeds for the cassava farming to increase her crop yield. She hopes to get a bigger crop yield so as to better support the family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing and paid worker’s fees and buy seeds for her cassava farm to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Leticia; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de molinera, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua moliendo granos como habas, trigo entre otros productos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Leticia; she continues with her milling business. She has been in this business for some time now and she is doing fine due to her determination every day. She continues grinding grains, such as beans and wheat, among other products. She wants to keep working this way to be able to keep supporting her family.  

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her loan payments. She is requesting the loan to buy corn and other products.

loans.use: to buy corn and other products.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, harina, chicharrón, quesillo, plátano, etc., para elaborar la venta de antojitos e iniciar un nuevo rubro como lo es la venta de pupusas, de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias y resarcir la nueva deuda.
El crédito anterior le permitió remodelar el local de su negocio y tener materia prima para preparar su venta, sus clientes tienen un lugar más cómodo para compartir mientras esperan ser atendidos, sus ingresos son mayores y su familia vive en mejores circunstancias, tiene una hija recién nacida.
texts.en:
Mercedes needs a new loan to purchase oil, flour, cracklings, cheese, bananas, etc, in order to develop the sale of snacks and to start a new line such as the sale of pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas), so in this way to increase her earnings and repay the new debt.
The previous loan allowed her to remodel her business locale and to have raw materials in order to prepare her sales.  Her customers have a more comfortable space to share while waiting to be served, her income is greater and her family lives in better circumstances.  She has a newborn daughter.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, cracklings, cheese, bananas, etc. in order to develop the sale of snacks and to start a new line such as the sale of pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas).

loans.name: Saroeurt's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Battambang province, Saroeurt is 53 years old and a married mother who has six children, three of whom are depending on her and two who are in school. The main income of this family is from rice growing, which she has been involved in for 10 years. Sometimes she works as a paid worker to supplement income. 

Due to lacking of working capital, Saroeurt formed a three-member group to apply for a new loan, which will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which was completely paid back, has enabled her to improve her living conditions and buy more household appliances to use. As the group leader, Saroeurt will use her portion of loan to pay for the plowing fee, and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to boost her crop yields. She hopes she can earn more income to upgrade the standard of living and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to boost her crop yields.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is 57 years old and a widowed mother of four children, two of whom are dependent children. For her living, she grows rice as her single main source of income. She can save income of about 37,000 KHR each day. Her crops have not grown well and this caused her to gain lower yields than she expected. 

Thol has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. She wisely paid back her past loans which have helped her to upgrade her family's condition. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more fertilizer to grow fruitful crops. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow fruitful crops.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 28-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her two sons are studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for five years. Her husband is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Rizwana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothes business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en: Gulmira is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in a remote and beautiful place with her parents. She is a fourth-year student. She studies with excellence and is well known among friends and students. She is a communicative, confident, active and goal oriented person. She likes to study and wants to work on her self-development. She studies at a commercial university and needs to pay her tuition fee on time. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to pay her education costs. She applied to Kiva asking for a loan to pay her education costs for her studies. She awaits your compassion and support.

loans.use: to pay her education costs for her studies

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 35 years old and has two children. Ligaya is married and has two children who are in school.

Ligaya is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ligaya has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mercedes Cecilia

texts.es:
Mercedes solicita un nuevo crédito para seguir teniendo un negocio competitivo, comprara fardos de ropa usada, lo que le dará oportunidad de tener prendas de vestir lo suficientemente surtidas para satisfacer a sus clientes.
Con la ayuda de créditos surte con rapidez su negocio, teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una vida con menos carencias y además mantener su buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is requesting a new loan in order to continue to have a competitive business.  She will buy bales of used clothing which will give her the opportunity to have articles of clothing in an assortment sufficient enough to satisfy her customers.
With the help of loans, she stocks her business rapidly, having as a consequence better income in order to give her family a life with less shortages and in addition maintain her good credit credentials.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing which will give her the opportunity to have articles of clothing in an assortment sufficient enough to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 45-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her two sons and one daughter are studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 18 years. He is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Shahida is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, aged 40, is a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She has two elementary-school-aged children with her partner named Victor who has a school service for kids in their neighborhood. The couple help each other raise their children and provide for their daily needs.  

Julieta has operated a party-needs store for almost eight years already. Her income from this business has helped cover their daily sustenance and the school needs of her children. Most Filipinos hold family and friends gatherings and special occasions at their homes or clubhouses. It is more economical than holding parties at restaurants. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives and the local community. 

To help her continue and improve her services she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy a tent, a "videoke" machine and other party needs like a table and balloons. Although most Filipinos live simple lives, special occasions like birthdays, wedding anniversaries, high school and college graduations, and family and school reunions are held close to their hearts. They will save as much as they can to celebrate these important events and milestones in their lives. 

Julieta aims to acquire her own vehicle to transport tables, chairs and a music machine to her customers. She wants her children to earn a college degree to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a tent, "videoke" machine and other party needs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 54 years old and has five children. Imelda is married and has two children who are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Imelda has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Helen has a business making shell crafts in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like thread, etc.

Helen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like thread, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José, es consiente que necesita de un nuevo crédito para mantener su fuente de subsistencia funcionando, comprara frijoles, arroz, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, etc., para tener mercadería suficiente con la que disminuirá las necesidades de sus clientes.
El financiamiento anterior le ha sido de mucha utilidad para que la tienda de consumo sea más competitiva, tiene un poco más de rentabilidad y así ha podido ir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
José is aware that he needs a new loan in order to keep his means of subsistence functioning. He will buy beans, rice, oil, candies, soft drinks, etc., in order to have sufficient merchandise to meet the needs of his customers.

The previous financing was very useful to him so that his store of consumer products could be more competitive. He has a little more profitability and thus has been able to continue meeting his obligations.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, candies, soft drinks, etc., in order to have sufficient merchandise to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en: Fehmeeda is a 40-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 20 years. Her husband is the only person responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Fehmeeda's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Fehmeeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Fehmeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business

loans.name: Lucelinda

texts.en: Lucelinda is a 55-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She does not have a child or a partner in life. To earn a living, she has been running a poultry business. She has been doing this business for three years. Lucelinda works hard so she can provide for herself in the future. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and additional chicks to raise. In the future, she dreams of increasing her livelihood for a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Michelle has a business making shell crafts in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shells and thread to use for her business.

Michelle has been in this business for three years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells and thread to use for her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen has successfully established her business selling milk and animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales to earn profits. She aspires to save money to provide her family with a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales to earn profits.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. Shahida is a motivated mother of three children. She is responsible to provide them with good quality food, health and clothing. To improve her business, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, thread and needles in a large quantity. This will help her cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, thread and needles in a large quantity. This will help her cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash

loans.name: Marvin Eduardo

texts.es:
Marvin es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es feliz mente casado con una linda familia, él trabaja como policía municipal de tránsito a parte de su panadería, gracias a estas dos actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, pues él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior el logro comprar sus materiales y su negocio ahora ya cuenta con mucho más productos y eso le ha beneficiado a él y a su familia, pero ahora Marvin tiene la necesidad de construir un segundo piso de su casa pues con el paso de los años su familia ha ido creciendo, pero una de las dificultades que Marvin tiene es no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder empezar a construir, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materiales como; cemento, block, hierro y arena.
El gran sueño de Marvin es poder contar con una casa mucho mejor para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Marvin is a man of 25. He is happily married with a beautiful family. He works as a municipal traffic policeman in addition to his bakery. Thanks to these two activities, he has managed to move his family ahead, since he says that thanks to the previous loan, he managed to buy his materials and his business now has many more products. This has benefited him and his family, but now Marvin needs to build a second floor on his house, since with the passing of time his family has been growing. But one of the difficulties that Marvin has is that he doesn't have sufficient money to be able to begin building. For this reason, he is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy materials such as cement, blocks, iron, and sand.

Marvin's great dream is to be able to have a much better house so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Vanni

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Vanni is 34 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to support four of her children, two of whom are in school and two who are too young to attend school. She grows rice as her main source of income. She also raises several pigs to sell and takes some free time to work for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her husband helps to overcome her family’s hardships by fishing. She has been involved in her business for 16 years and she can save about 38,200 KHR each day. Her rice did not grow well because it has destroyed by insects. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wisely paid back her past loan, which enabled her to get more income to support her children’s education. She will manage her loan portion to buy fishing material and buy piglets for raise. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing material and to buy piglets to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Las Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Consuelo tiene 40 años de edad, esta soltera con 2 hijos pero solo 1 depende aun de ella. Pertenece a la alcancía comunal “LAS MANOS UNIDAS” donde tiene el cargo de presidenta desde hace 1 año y está integrada por 6 mujeres decididas a cumplir con sus objetivos propuestos. Consuelo tiene como fuente de trabajo la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir que realiza en el taller de su vecino del barrio por donde vive. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una máquina de coser que necesita para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella tiene como plan a futuro implementar su propio taller de confecciones en casa y seguir brindando una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. En la foto grupal Consuelo se encuentra sentada en medio de las demás socias sentadas.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 40, is single with two children, but only one still depends on her.  She belongs to the communal bank "LAS MANOS UNIDAS" of which she has been the president for one year and it is composed of six women dedicated to their proposed objectives.  
Consuelo has as her source of work the creation of all types of articles of clothing which she does in the workshop of a neighbor in the neighborhood where she lives.
The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers. She has as a future plan to implement her own sewing shop in her house and continue offering a better quality of life to her son.
In the group photo, Consuelo is the one seated in the middle of the other partners.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a big town with her family. She is married. Her husband is a manager in a construction company. She is working at the translating organization “Globus.” It is her first year of working and she tries her best to show her capabilities and strength. Her mother is ill. She wishes to treat her at the hospital. Her salary cannot cover the medical service. She is applying to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to treat her mother at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her mother at the hospital

loans.name: Badelin

texts.en:
Badelin is 26 years old and has two children. Badelin is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Badelin is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Badelin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Badelin has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Badelin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 35 years old and married with one child in school. Sylvia works very hard to provide for them.

Sylvia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, candies, school supplies, and other groceries.

Sylvia has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, candies, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Shabina

texts.en:
Shabina is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 30 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband requires maintenance of his taxi. Because the current condition of his taxi is not good it requires more repair charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make the repairs of his taxi. Therefore, Shabina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Shabina's husband can afford the repair cost easily and provide better transport to earn more income. Shabina  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Shabina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wants to repair his taxi

loans.name: Jose Jilmer

texts.es:
José Jilmer tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el Caserío El Frayle del Distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; tiene un hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos años de edad, los cuales estudian en las escuelas de la zona, José vive y trabaja en comunión con su Distrito, vive en la parte rural del Caserío pero cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza José Jilmer es cria y venta de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y pollos, y también se dedica la elaboración de pan, bizcochos y dulces hace ya 10 años, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para implementar su negocio, comprar animales pequeños, engordarlos y venderlos y materia prima para la elaboraciones de sus panes, de esta manera podrá ofertar mejores productos a sus vecinos y clientes, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Jilmer is 35 years old. He lives in the hamlet of El Frayle in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. He has a stable household with his partner and their four minor children, who go to the schools in the zone. José lives and works in fellowship with his district. He lives in the rural part of the hamlet but he has water and electrical services.

The work that José Jilmer does is raising and selling small animals such as pigs, hens, and chickens, and he has also worked making bread, cakes, and sweets for 10 years. He has a lot of experience in this area. 

The destiny of the loan will be to furnish his businesses, to buy small animals to fatten and sell, and to buy basic ingredients to make his breads. In this way he will be able to offer more products to his neighbors and customers. With that, he will obtain better income in order to thus be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell, and to buy basic ingredients to make his breads.

loans.name: Cresie

texts.en:
Cresie works hard to support her family. Cresie is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Cresie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Cresie has been in this business for 28 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cresie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eledina

texts.en:
Eledina is 41 years old and has one child in school.

Eledina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eledina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eledina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eledina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 48-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her one son and two daughters are studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 22 years. Her husband is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Yasmeen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlene, vive en casa familiar junto a su madre y un hijo de dos años de edad, ella es soltera y tiene la responsabilidad de sacar delante a su hijo, no tiene parientes que le ayuden económicamente, tiene como negocio la venta de pupusas y tortillas, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, nació a raíz de la falta de empleo y el deseo de superación.
No tiene el equipo necesario para tener un negocio más rentable, ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar sartenes, platos, cucharas, vasos, entre otros utensilios que necesita para cocinar, asimismo invertirá en harina, maíz, aceite, tomates, repollos, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas y tortillas, su proyección es realizar sus actividades de manera más fácil y rápida para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Marlene sueña con tener nuevos ingresos, cancelar su deuda y cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the family house with her mother and a two-year-old son.  She is single and has the responsibility to bring up her son.  She doesn't have relatives to help her economically.  She has a business selling tortillas and pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas).  She learned this business from her mother.  It was born out of a lack of employment and a desire to get ahead.
She doesn't have the equipment necessary to have a more profitable business.  She has decided to request a loan to buy frying pans, plates, spoons, glasses, among other utensils necessary for cooking as well as to invest in flour, corn, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. in order to develop the sale of pupusas and tortillas.  Her concept is to complete her work in the easiest and fastest way in order to better attend to her customers.
Marlene dreams of having new income, paying off her debts, and covering the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy frying pans, plates, spoons, glasses, among other utensils needed for cooking as well as to invest in flour, corn, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Barrio La Unión Sector Kiosco Group

texts.es:
Feliza (la tercera del lado izquierdo de la foto) es un mujer de 47 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia que es su razón por la que se esmera día a día para darles lo mejor, con la iniciativa que tuvo para solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, le fue muy bien, a Dios gracias logro incrementar sus productos de abarrotes con el que ahora genera mejores ingresos, esto lo ha motivado a ella para solicitar un nuevo préstamo porque se dio cuenta que con los créditos es posible superarse, con este crédito ella comprara productos como; golosinas, gaseosas, azúcar, frijol arroz. Con esta nueva inversión Feliza espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes y que sus ingresos siguen mejorando.
Feliza sueña con poder ver su negocio más grande y que comprar terreno para que sus hijos tengan donde construir.
texts.en:
Feliza (the third one from the left side in the photo) is a woman of 47. She is married, with a beautiful family who is her reason for going to great effort every day in order to give them the best. With the initiative that she took to apply for a loan to invest in her business, it went very well for her. Thanks to God she managed to increase her grocery products, with which she now generates better income. This has motivated her to apply for a new loan, because she realized that with the loans it is possible to better oneself.

With this loan, she will buy products such as candies, soft drinks, sugar, beans, and rice. With this new investment, Feliza hopes to better satisfy the needs of her customers and to have her income continue to improve. 

Feliza dreams of being able to see her business become larger and buying land so that her children will have a place to build.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as candies, soft drinks, sugar, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
En el municipio de La Estrella, habitan muchas personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro; una de ellas es Gladys, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como un hobbie pero que poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Ella, siendo una madre muy joven, no tenía mucha experiencia, pero tiene un gran corazón y energía.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de artículos de bisutería.

Con estos elementos tener un mejor inventario de insumos para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
In the municipality of La Estrella live many enterprising and hard-working people with the desire and strength to get ahead and struggle for a good future.  One of these is Gladys, a woman who with her charisma and great capacity to work has been able to overcome various obstacles that have arisen in her life.
She has a very small business dedicated to the creation and sales of handicrafts in her own house, a job she began as a hobby but little by little it became a source of real income for the sustenance of her family.
Being a young mother, she didn't have much experience, but she has a big heart and energy.
She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the creation of articles of jewelry.
With these things, she will have a better inventory in order to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the creation of articles of jewelry.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 41 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like home care products, liquor, and other groceries.

Joy has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like home care products, liquor, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dina Rosalía

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer casada de 18 años de edad, con un hijo de cinco años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.
Dina es una gran mujer porque para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de almacigo, con esta actividad ella ya lleva tres años, aunque con este negocio le quedan muy poca ganancias, es por eso que ella también se dedica a la cultivo de café y banano. Dina es muy entusiasta y de grandes sueños, es por ello que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para la compra de una cuerda de terreno donde ella espera poder cultivar café en la próxima temporada.
Dina tiene el anhelo de poder comprar más terreno donde ella pueda cultivar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dina is an 18-year-old woman, who is married and has a 5-year-old son. They live in a community in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.

Dina is an impressive woman because, to support her husband with household expenses, she works buying and selling copperwood. She has been doing this for three years, although the business gives them little income. For this reason, she also grows coffee and bananas.

Dina is very enthusiastic and has big dreams, so she has decided to request a loan. She will invest it in the purchase of a small plot of land where she hopes to be able to grow coffee during the next season.

Dina longs to be able to buy more land where she can grow crops and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to cultivate

loans.name: Keivin Alcides

texts.es:
Keivin es un microempresario dedicado y trabajador, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operario en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 24 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 2 empleos directos; trabaja todos los días; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar en su casa con la carga económica.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina de codo, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Keivin sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción.
texts.en:
Kelvin is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur. His area of work is sewing, offering third-party services.

Everything began some months ago when he was working as an operator in a sewing workshop. Now, at the age of 24, he already has his own workshop in which he directly generates two jobs. He works every day. In this way, he generates sufficient resources to help with the economic responsibilities of his house.

The loan that he is applying for will be invested in the purchase of a double-stitch jeans sewing machine. Thus he will be able to meet the requirements of his customers and deliver the orders in a timely manner, with the goal of increasing production and acquiring new contracts, which will allow him to give continuity to his micro-enterprise.

Kelvin dreams of continuing to strengthen his workshop and having a greater level of production every day.

loans.use: to buy a double stitch jeans sewing machine to increase the production in his workshop

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a 45-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Out of these seven children, she has six children that still attend school. Her husband is a fisherman while she sells fish. Wilma and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their children, and especially to send their children to school. In the future, she dreams of being successful in her business. In order to upturn their livelihood, she is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to buy big foam pieces (used for storing fish).

loans.use: to buy fish and foam (used for storing fish).

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Cristina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 33 years old and has two children. Ivy is married and one of her children is in school.

Ivy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ivy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ivy has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ivy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 39 years old and her two children are in school.

Elvira has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Digaale Group

texts.en: Safiya Aw Adan was born in Gabiley in 1945, and now she is 70 years old. Safiya is a business women. She has a shop in Gabiley town and she established her shop in 1986, before the war broke out in Somalia, and again in 1993 after the war. Her shop is one of the oldest shops in Gabiley. Safiya is the mother of eight children. Safiya requested from Kaaba Microfinance a loan of $1500 to enlarge her business operations. She will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, etc. Safiya is the leader of a group consisting of six women and four men. Each group member has his/her separate business, so each client will take a separate loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Letezia

texts.en:
Sari-sari store businesses in the Philippines are rampant. In the comfort of your own home you can manage your own store. Filipinos prefer to buy items in a sari-sari store, since most are just located in neighborhoods, Baranggays and barrios, so you don't have to pay fairs going to cities just to buy items. Sari-sari is a Filipino word which means “variant,” where items are cheaper since products are purchased on wholesale but are sold by piece, kilo or by volume to consumers. Candies, biscuits, seasonings, canned goods and such are sold by piece. Peanut butter, mayonnaise and other spreads are sold by volume while rice and animal feeds are measured by kilos.

Letezia, one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), is a housewife and a sari-sari store owner. She enjoys managing the store since she can take care of her family while running the business. Indeed, this became a medium for her to support her family’s needs. However, she doesn't earn good profit in the business all the time. She still needs capital to buy additional products so that her store will become a one-stop-shop. Letezia applied for a P25, 000 loan as added capital, since she aims to expand the business by adding products like canned goods, sugar, oil, soda and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG).

Letezia is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, repays Micro Finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to expand the business by adding products like canned goods, sugar, oil, soda, and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG).

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 45 years old and has five children. Alma is married and has two children who are in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Luz Fany

texts.es:
Luz tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de materia prima para preparar pan.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con un mejor inventario de insumos.
texts.en:
Luz has excellent experience in bakery work.  Some time ago she started her own bakery which so far has been productive for her.
She has always preferred to work independently, and works daily from 8AM till 9PM.  

Luz now needs help to buy materials for making bread.  The loan will allow her to work in better circumstances and to guarantee the quality of her work.  Her big dream is to be able to run a good bakery which distributes to different stores.  With this help Luz will be able to work in a better organized way and with a better inventory of supplies.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bread

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Esmeralda is 35 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Esmeralda has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Esmeralda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Con la comercialización de útiles escolares y productos para el hogar en su papelería, Maria ha podido construir una vida junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos.
Esta actividad viene ejerciéndola hace aproximadamente 3 años y la aprendió a través del conocimiento empírico.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares al por mayor para surtir su inventario y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con este negocio es que pagara la educación de sus hijos y mejorara su vivienda.
texts.en:
By selling school supplies and home products in her stationery shop, Maria has been able to build a life with her husband and their three children.
She has been working in this way for about three years and learned it through her own experience in practice.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy school supplies in bulk to stock as inventory and to increase her working capital, since this business allows her to pay for school for her children and improve their home.

loans.use: to buy school supplies in bulk to stock her inventory

loans.name: Mario Valmore

texts.es:
Mario, comparte su vida con su familia compuesta por su esposa de 37 años de edad y sus dos hijos con edades de 17 y 15 años, es propietario de un taller de estructuras metálicas y una carpintería, en su colonia ya es muy popular, toda la familia de una u otra forma colabora en el negocio.
Solicita un crédito para comprar madera, clavos, pegamento, pintura, etc., fortalecerá en esta ocasión el inventario de la carpintería, podrá satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, sus obras tendrán mayor calidad y espera que le generaren mejores ganancias.
Su visión es enseñarle a sus hijos el oficio para que ellos puedan establecer su propio negocio y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Mario shares his life with his family, including his wife, who is 37 years old and his two children, aged 15 and 17.  He is the owner of a shop for metal structures and carpentry.  In his area the business is already very popular.  His whole family helps in the work in one or another way.  

Mario is asking for a loan to buy wood, nails, adhesives, and paint to strengthen the inventory in his carpentry at his time and thus meet his customers' needs.  Having more inventory will add quality to his work products and he hopes to earn more income.  His vision is to teach his children this profession so that they can  eventually establish their own business and do even better.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, adhesives, and paint to strengthen the inventory in his carpentry and thus meet his customers' needs

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a resident of Angwete in Lira town. She is a married lady and has three daughters. Stella struggles to maintain her family and educate her children through her business proceeds. Stella is running the business of selling silver fish and smoked fish, where she moves from market to market selling. Due to the market availability of silver fish, Stella's business has been well-boosted. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help her boost her business by buying more stock of the fish, in order to meet her clients' demands. Above all she is grateful to UGAFODE micro finance and KIVA funders for their support .

loans.use: to buy more silver fish to sell.

loans.name: David Napoleon

texts.es:
David, posee casa propia, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, una de ellas trabaja y la otra estudia, tiene 20 años de vivir en su comunidad, su negocio es el de brindar sus servicios de construcción o albañilería y realiza viajes en su pickup, tiene 15 años de tener un negocio bien establecido, el oficio de albañilería lo aprendió con amigos y adquirió más experiencia asistiendo a clases impartidas por una institución dedicada a brindar diferentes cursos de superación.
Tiene necesidad de un financiamiento para pagar cambio de llantas y pequeñas reparaciones de su vehículo, le permitirá tener a su disposición un vehículo en perfectas condiciones para trabajar, espera que sus clientes sigan prefiriendo sus servicios y realizar sus actividades con normalidad.
Los objetivos que él tiene son cancelar su deuda y tener en su hogar el sustento diario.
texts.en: David has his own home and lives with his wife and two daughters. One of his daughters works and the other goes to school. He has been living in his community for 20 years. His business is providing construction or masonry services and he makes his trips in his truck. He has had a well established business for 15 years. He learned the masonry trade with friends and acquired more experience attending classes given by an institution dedicated to providing various training courses. He has the need for a loan to pay to change his tires and make small repairs to his vehicle. This will allow him to have at his disposal a vehicle in perfect condition for work. He hopes his customers continue to prefer his services and that he can conduct his business normally. His goals are to pay off his debt and to have in his home daily sustenance.

loans.use: to pay for a change of tires and small repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y calzado, tiene 10 años de realizar este negocio, lo hace de manera ambulante y cuenta con un puesto fijo en el mercado municipal, vive en casa propia, su familia se compone por su esposo y 4 hijos, todos están estudiando, ella procura atender a su familia y su negocio.
Motivada a seguir ampliando su negocio, requiere de capital de trabajo para comprar nuevos estilos de pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc., así como también calzado, incrementara las opciones de compra para sus clientes y de esta manera las posibilidades de aumentar sus ventas e ingresos serán más concretas.
Para María es importante mantenerse trabajando para cancelar su deuda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
María works selling clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years. She sells door-to-door and also has a stall at the municipal market. She lives in her own home. Her family is made up of her husband and four children, all of her children are in school. She makes sure to look after her family and her business. 

Motivated to keep expanding her business, she needs working capital to buy new styles of pants, shirts, blouses, etc. as well as shoes. She will increase the buying options for her customers and the possibility of increasing her sales and income will be more concrete. For María it's important to keep working to pay off her debt and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy new styles of pants, shirts, blouses, etc. and also buy shoes.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria continua atendiendo la tienda de consumo que actualmente ha crecido gracias a la ayuda del financiamiento anterior, su negocio es de subsistencia pero aun así su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
Considerando que tiene un inventario poco surtido ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, café, detergente, etc., de esta manera sus clientes tendrán un lugar en donde encontrar lo que necesiten, espera mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Gloria continues tending to her store where she sells basic consumer products. Her store has currently grown thanks to her previous loan. Her business is of subsistence but even so her family has a better lifestyle. Taking into account that her inventory is not well stocked, she has decided to request a new loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, detergent, etc. so that her customers will have a place where they can find what they need. She hopes to maintain the continuity of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 49 years old and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dionesia has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dionesia has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Others that doesn’t have their own house to live in prefer to just rent a home. Considering the rental, accessibility of the location and neighbors as well. On the other hand, owning an apartment is very complex since you need to consider those. It should have strong foundation, the ceiling should not leak every time it rains, it should be well-ventilated, the place should be accessible to the market, schools and hospitals. This is a business that doesn’t require a day-to-day monitoring, but the quality of the house itself should be maintained. 

Liwayway has been into this kind of business and she’s grateful about the monetary support (business loan) that CCT granted to her last year. The loan helped her buy materials for the house renovation. This year, Liwayway applied for another loan of 30,000 PHP to continue the renovation so that the house for rent that she owns will be ready for any calamity change. Moreover, people renting there will be more comfortable and satisfied with their stay.

Liwayway regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to renovate her house-rental business.

loans.name: Sufian

texts.en:
Sufian is a 19-year-old single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip - which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. Sufian has a boat that traps fish to sell to stores. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but his boat has become old and worn out. 

Sufian took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new network and repair his boat. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new network and repair his boat.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school. Jona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Jona has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has three children, two of whom go to school and one who is still under school age. She lives in a very modest house with her family and her husband, who is a farmer. Angelina has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involved in business activities since 2012 and feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Angelina to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as milk, eggs, sugar, rice, cigarettes, coffee, biscuits, salt and candles. 

Running a business has made Angelina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, eggs, sugar, rice, cigarettes, coffee, biscuits, salt and candles.

loans.name: Ma. Jogie

texts.en:
Ma. Jogie is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Jogie is 43 years old and has six children who are in school.

Ma. Jogie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ma. Jogie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Suresh Chandra

texts.en:
Suresh Chandra, 30, is married and is blessed with three beautiful kids. He hails from a small village of Angul district. He is differently-abled and has been engaged in poultry farming for the last five years. He is the owner of three poultry farm and earns a good income from them which he uses to buy his own medicines, meet the daily household expenses and his children's educational expenses.

Suresh Chandra is a very enterprising, intelligent and hard-working man who has overcome each and every hurdle in his life very smoothly.

Suresh Chandra is requesting a loan amount of 35,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to purchase more chicken birds and feed for them. This will help him to raise more chickens which will subsequently result in higher return on investments.

Suresh Chandra aspires to provide the best education and a bright future to his children and to live happily with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken birds and feed for them.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el estado de Puebla. Ella tiene 20 años de casada, desde que se casó dejó su trabajo como empleada para convertirse en ama de casa, sin embargo ella es una mujer inquieta que siempre está pensando en que hacer o como mejorar su situación, por esa razón ella inició un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y lencería por catálogo, ella quiere en un futuro poder establecer su negocio en un lugar físico así como poder ofrecer otro tipo de productos. Obdulia es una mujer muy tenaz que siempre alcanza lo que se propone, y que siempre busca nuevos retos.  Con un préstamo de MXN 12,000 ella podrá invertir en un volumen muy grande de zapatos para niños y aprovechar la temporada de regreso a clases. Ella está muy entusiasmada con este préstamo por que podrá tener un margen mayor de ganancias, también agradece a todas los prestamistas que la ayudan.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 40 years old, married, has two children and lives in the state of Puebla. She has been married for 20 years, and when she got married she left her job as an employee to become a housewife. However, she is a restless woman who is always thinking about what to do or how to improve her situation, and for that reason she started a business selling clothing, shoes and lingerie from a catalog. In the future she wants to be able to establish her business in a physical place so that she can offer other types of products.
Obdulia is a very tenacious woman who always achieves what she sets out to, and who always looks for new challenges. With a loan of MXN 12,000 she will be able to invest in a very large volume of children's shoes and take advantage of the 'back to school' season. She is very excited about this loan because she will be able to have a bigger profit margin, so she also thanks everyone who helps her by lending money.

loans.use: to invest in a large volume of children's shoes and to take advantage of the 'back to school' season

loans.name: Jose Isidoro

texts.es:
José, da las gracias por el apoyo que Padecomsm y Kiva le dieron cuando lo ha necesitado, con el crédito anterior pudo tener los recursos necesarios para fortalecer la granja de gallinas ponedoras en su momento, ya que él no contaba con capital para hacerlo, su familia se mantiene, hoy les puede dar mejor alimentación y vestuario.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar concentrado, desparasitantes y vitaminas, para cuidar mejor las gallinas ponedoras y mantenerlas saludables para venderlas y aumentar la producción de huevos, con el resto realizara reparaciones en el lugar destinado para almacenar los huevos, su finalidad es mantener con vida su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is thankful for the support Padecomsm and Kiva gave him when he needed it. With his previous loan he was able to build his laying hen farm stronger, when it was time to and he did not have the money to do it. He was able to support his family and today can give them a better nutrition and better clothes.

He is choosing to take out a new loan to buy concentrate, dewormer, and vitamins to take better care of his laying hens and to keep them healthy to sell them and increase the egg production. With the rest he will make repairs to the place designated to store the eggs.

The purpose is, to keep his business alive.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, dewormer, and vitamins to take better care of his laying hens and keep them healthy to sell them and increase the egg production.

loans.name: Grupo Maxanijanil Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer  que se esmera día con día para darle a su familia lo mejor, ella tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a la venta de berro por bultos, a Dios gracias con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien  pues gracias a ello, logro comprar sus 20 bultos de berro que le dejo a ella una bonita ganancia, Antonia es una de las mujeres con mucho entusiasmo que contagia a las demás personas, ella ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de berro, pues esta es una de las hiervas que menos se consigue y que es muy vendible, por lo que sus clientes no se dan abasto con lo poco que ella ahora logra comprar con su capital.
Antonia espera poder mejorar sus ganancias con esta nueva inversión para comprar un terreno donde ella pueda cultivar.
texts.en:
Antonia is woman that goes to a lot of effort every day to provide her family with best. She has now been selling watercress in bulk for several years. Thanks to a previous loan, she has done very well as it allowed her to buy 20 loads of watercress which, in turn, provided her with a decent income when sold. Antonia is one of those women whose enthusiasm is contagious and spreads to others. She is now asking for a new loan so that she can carry on investing in her watercress business. Watercress is not one of the more common plants and it is very sellable, which is the reason why her clients are not satisfied with the small amount that she can currently afford to buy.

Antonia hopes to be able to improve her income with this new investment so that she can later buy land where she can grow her own plants.

loans.use: to buy and sell watercress in bulk.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad practica la crianza de ganado y cultiva maíz y frijol en aproximadamente una manzana y media de terreno, de esta forma genera ingresos para tener el sustento para su familia; vive con su esposa de 24 años de edad y tienen cinco hijos.
Comprará abono y pesticidas para cuidar que sus cultivos tengan un desarrollo adecuado y le den una cosecha más abundante, espera realizar ventas altas y tener nuevos ingresos para comprar alimento para el ganado y resarcir la deuda.
Natividad sueña con tener una ganadería más grande y disminuir en gran manera las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Natividad raises cattle and grows maize and broad beans on approximately a block and a half of land. This is how he supports his family.
He lives with his wife, who is 24. They have five children.
Natividad will buy manure and pesticides to tend to his crops, so that they grow as they should and yield a more plentiful harvest.
He hopes for high sales and better earnings and plans to buy cattle feed and repay the loan.
Natividad dreams of increasing the size of his chattel and of providing for his family's every need.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to tend to his crops so that they yield a more plentiful harvest.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
