Víctor  es una persona que elaborara ataúdes para ponerlos a la venta, actividad que desarrolla desde hace cinco años, trabaja con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió de un amigo; vive con su madre, su esposa e hijos, todos comparten un entorno lleno de armonía.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar madera, clavos, pintura, entre otros materiales para fabricar ataúdes, ahorrara con la inversión, ofrecerá sus productos a un costo accesible para sus clientes, pero también tendrá mejores ganancias, espera tener resultados positivos.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio tener estabilidad económica y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Víctor has been making coffins that he later sells for five years. He works from eight in the morning until four in the evening. He learnt this profession from a friend. He lives with his mum, his wife and children in a peaceful environment.

He is asking for a loan to buy wood, nails, paint and other materials that are used to make coffins. He will save money with the investment and will offer his products to clients at an affordable price. However, he is also hoping to have positive results from the investment and earn a better income.

He dreams about expanding his business, being financially stable and fulfilling all his responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint and other materials used to make coffins. He will save money with the investment and will offer his products to clients at an affordable price.

loans.name: Sagara-Rusha Group

texts.fr:
Sylvestre fait partie du groupe  Sagara-Rusha et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Joselyne,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 14 ans,dont  5 étudient . 

Il fait le commerce de  riz,sucre,sel...  depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son    crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de riz, de sel,.. mais, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,et voir ses enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Sylvestre belongs to the Sagara-Rusha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Joselyne, who is a farmer. They have six children together, aged between three and 14 years old; five of the children are studying. Sylvestre has been selling rice, sugar, salt... for the past two years and this is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy rice, salt, corn ...; to resell, so he can make more money.

In the coming years he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy rice, salt,..to earn more money.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Hard work and patience has been Delia’s guiding principle in running her variety store. She has operated her variety store for ten years. Delia also cultivates her 8,000 sq. meter rice field.

She wishes to purchase stocks of grocery items such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil and seasonings that’s why she’s requesting for a loan of PHP 10,000.

Through this loan amount she could further increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 58 years old and has seven children.

Magdalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Magdalina has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purchase order cards in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Gloria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more purchase orders cards to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase orders cards to sell.

loans.name: Kebura Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas  fait partie du groupe  Kubura et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 29 ans et est marié à Alphonsine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans. 

Il a fait le commerce de riz, de haricot de l’huile de  palme,…dans sa  boutique  depuis  11ans. 

Il est son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et  de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter des lopins de terre pour la cultiver, et voir ses enfants étudie
texts.en:
Léonidas belongs to the Kubura group and lives in Gitega. He is 29 years old and married to Alphonsine, who is a farmer. They have three children together whose ages range between one and ten years old.

Léonidas has been selling rice, beans and palm oil in his shop for the past 11 years and is on his seventh loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted he is going to buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell so he can make more money.

In the coming years, he would like buy patches of land to farm and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so he can earn more money.

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: Ali est commerçante membre du groupe de crédits Uwezo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 53 ans, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 4 sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons dans une buvette dans un quartier animé de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en équipements de travail (caisses vides et chaises plastics). Elle débuta son activité avec des fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ali is a trader, member of the Uwezo credit group, client of Hekima MFI. She is married, 53 years old and the mother of 8 children, of which 4 are in school and 4 are already married. Ali has been selling drinks in a small bar in a lively neighbourhood in the city for five years. She is going to purchase work equipment (empty cases and plastic chairs). She started her activity with funds that she received from her husband. She wishes to build a house, and to provide for the schooling and feeding of her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support that they give to financially excluded entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase work equipment (empty cases and plastic chairs)

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Dalar village and is the mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Anahit's daughter is married and lives separately with her family in a nearby village. Anahit lives with her son, husband and mother-in-law who is a 74-year-old elderly retired pensioner.

To earn a daily living, Anahit started her small bakery business three years ago. With the big support of her husband, Anahit makes the bread and sells it to local food stores and markets.

Anahit is asking for this loan to purchase a car to transport bread to the shops.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this kind and enthusiastic woman to improve her bakery business.

loans.use: to pay for a car to transport bread to the shops.

loans.name: Intambwe Group

texts.fr:
Marc  fait partie du groupe  Intambwe et  habite à  Gitega.Il a 45 ans et est marié à Marie,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, tous   étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de chèvres   depuis  3 ans. 

Il est  à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Marc belongs to the Intambwe group and lives in Gitega. He is forty-five years old and married to Marie, a farmer. Together they have four children, all of whom are students.
Marc has been in the goat sales business for three years. He is on his third loan cycle with Turame. With the Kiva loan he will receive, he intends to increase his capital so as to purchase many goats for resale, so that he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase several goats for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old rural smallholder farmer in Nandi Hills, Kenya. He lives and works on a 3-acre farmland where he does dairy, poultry and horticultural farming. He started farming when he was 19 and to date, he has never looked back. He aspires to grow his business and improve his family's livelihood.

Peter is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. He has been using the sames tools year in year out and it's time for him to upgrade in order to restore efficiency in his work.

He will use the borrowed money to buy modern tools that are better designed, easier to use and, more durable than the old tools. This will reduce downtime and make for a better quality of work on his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Ordelib

texts.es:
Ordelib tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente , vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaen, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ordelib se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Ordelib espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ordelib is 30 years old and lives with his life partner and two children in the rural district of Pomahuaca which is located in Jaen province in the region of Cajamarca which is in Peru's northern mountain range. The people of this district mainly work in agriculture, livestock farming and trade.

Ordelib makes a living raising and selling goats among other animals. His business is set up in his own home. He has been running this business for five years and has very good personal and work references from people in the area. The loan that he is asking for will be used to buy a greater number of animals as well as nutritionally balanced feed for the animals. From this investment Ordelib hopes to be able to offer his clients a better product which will, in turn, allow him to increase his income and thus improve his quality of life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals as well as nutritionally balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Nyangeyera Group

texts.fr:
Josélyne  fait partie du groupe Nyangeyera   et  habite à Muramvya. Elle  a 32 ans et est mariée à Diomède, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants    dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  tissus depuis 13 ans. 

Elle est à son quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  mètres de tissus  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait  acheter des terrains cultivables.
texts.en:
Josélyne is a member of the Nyangeyera group and lives in Muramvya. She is thirty-two years old and is married to Diomède, a tailor. Together they have four children, two of whom are in school.
Josélyne has been selling cloth for thirteen years. She is on her fourtheenth loan cycle with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she will receive, she will increase her capital in order to purchase many yards of cloth for resale, and so increase her earnings. In the next few years, she would like to purchase arable lands.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many yards of cloth for resale

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, comparte sus días con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, ella trabaja para aportar con los gastos de su familia, su negocio es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en su localidad y en los alrededores, el día de comercio se ubica con un puesto para vender licuados, es así como genera recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Invertirá en variedad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/as, asimismo comprara frutas para elaborar licuados, tendrá un inventario con nuevos productos de calidad y así desarrollará sus actividades sin problema alguno, tiene la esperanza que sus clientes aumenten.
Sus sueños son mejorar la vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y se puedan superar.
texts.en:
María shares her days with her life's companion and their two children, aged 9 and 5 years old. She doesn't have relatives abroad. She works to help with the household expenses. Her business is selling clothing door to door in her community and in surrounding areas. On market day she has a stall to sell smoothies. That is how she generates resources to cover the household needs.

She will invest in a variety of clothing for women, men and children. She will also buy fruit to make smoothies. She will have an inventory with new quality products. This way she will carry out her activities without any problems. She hopes that the number of customers will increase.

Her dream is improve her home and to help her children get an education so they can get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of clothing for women, men and children. She will also buy fruit to make smoothies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer trabajadora, muy responsable, y sincera ella tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de 7 años de edad que ya se encuentra estudiando primero primaria, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xejuyup Nahualá.
Antonia sabe que en la vida hay que ser atrevida, para poder lograr mejores condiciones de vida, es por ello que desde hace 6 años ella decidió elegir una actividad que le generara ingresos, y la actividad que ella escogió fue instalar un molino de nixtamal desde la comunidad de su hogar, pues esto le permite a Antonia realizar sus oficios y cuidar de su hijo, gracias a las ganancias su familia cuenta con lo necesario, sin embargo Antonia su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de un pedazo de terreno donde ellos puedan construir su casa propia, a raíz de esta necesidad Antonia solicita un préstamo para aprovechar una oportunidad  de comprar un terreno de 28 x 14 varas.
El gran sueño de Antonia es contar con su casa propia donde ella pueda instalar una tienda de abarrotes y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking, very responsible and sincere woman. She is 38 years old, single, and has a 7 year old son who is in primary school. This loving family lives in a community in the town of Xejuyup Nahualá.

Antonia knows that in life you have to be bold in order to achieve better living conditions. That is why 6 years ago, she decided to choose an activity that generates income for her. The activity she chose was opening a corn flour mill for the community in her home. This allows Antonia to do her housework and care for her son. Thanks to the profits, her family has what it needs. Nonetheless, Antonia's biggest need is the acquisition of a plot of land where they can build a home of their own. Based on this need, Antonia is asking for a loan to take advantage of an opportunity and buy a plot of land 28 x 14 varas.

Antonia's big dream is to have her own home where she can open a convenience store and improve her earnings.

loans.use: buy a plot of land for construction.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is 56 years old, married and has four children. She sells vegetables to make an income. She wants to keep improving her profits which is why she has asked for additional working capital for her business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more vegetables such as string beans, cabbages and squash to sell. This will help improve her sales and some day, pay for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe, está teniendo mayor afluencia de clientes en su tienda, por tal motivo se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar gaseosas, golosinas, pan, detergentes, entre otros productos para disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes.
El haber utilizado el crédito anterior para incrementar su inventario el resultado es positivo, tiene clientes satisfechos, mejores ventas e ingresos, su familia se mantiene igual y ella sigue motivada a seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio e incorporar otros productos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is having more customers in her store. That is why she has decided to ask for a new loan to buy sodas, snacks, bread, detergents, and more products to decrease the needs of her customers.

Having used the previous loan to increase inventory, she has had positive results. She has satisfied customers, and better sales and income. Her family is the same and she continues to be motivated to keep working and expand her business and include more products.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, bread, detergents, and more products to decrease the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a 25-year-old, single man from Gaza. He lives with his family in a small, old house. Muhammad has a boat to catch fish which he then sells to stores. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but his boat has become old and worn out.  He requested a USD  loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new net and repair his boat. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new net and repair his boat.

loans.name: Hizmat

texts.en: Hizmat is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1964 and lives in the village with her family. She is married and has five children. She is an agrarian. She plants agricultural products in her land for her business. Her children are helping her with her business. She is a hardworking, goal-oriented and gentle person. She tries to educate her children so they can be professional and live better. She thinks that being educated is the main point in life. She appealed to KIVA asking a loan to pay her son’s education costs. She awaits your compassion and support.

loans.use: to pay her son’s education costs.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 44 year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. She is a housewife and her husband works in a bakery where she helps.  They work very hard to help their family live in good conditions. Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school.  Nadia and her husband's only goal is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Liza has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fruit to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, 36, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Zenaida requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Beatriz

texts.es:
Nancy es una sonriente ama de casa de 38 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos todos ellos menores de edad, su vida gira entorno a ellos, su principal preocupación es tener insumos para elaborarles un alimento y mantenerles el estómago lleno, pero mantener 7 muchachos es bastante tediosos y su esposo tiene que trabajar largas jornadas laborales para lograrlo.

Nancy consciente de la situación necesita de tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio que será la cría de aves, decidió iniciar este negocio ya que lo puede hacer desde su hogar sin descuidar a sus hijos y además es una actividad que conoce perfectamente.

El apoyo económico que se encuentra solicitando Nancy es para la compra de pollos, alimento, construcción de bebederos y un galpón.
texts.en:
Nancy is a cheerful, 38 year old housewife. She is the mother of 7 children, all of them minors. Her life revolves around them. Her main worry is having the ingredients to make them food and keep their bellies full. But supporting 7 children is very tedious and her husband has to work long hours to do it.

Nancy is aware of the situation and she needs your help to start a business, which will be raising chickens. She decided to start this business because she can do it from home without neglecting her children, and it is an activity that she knows perfectly well.

The financial support that Nancy is asking for is to buy chickens and feed, and to build troughs and a shed.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and to build troughs and a shed.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man living with his five-member family in Irbid, a city in northern Jordan.

Ahmad goes to a private university to major in accounting. He is also working after school in a men's clothing store to afford paying for the university, as his father is retired and is living on his retirement salary, and his mother is a housewife.

Ahmad is applying for an education loan to help him cover his next semester fees.

loans.use: to cover his next semester fees.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is a 22-year-old single man living with his seven-member family in Irbid, a city in northern Jordan.

Zaid goes to a private university to major in accounting and he is in his third year now. Zaid also works after school, selling coffee in a kiosk at the bus station to afford paying for the university. He also helps his family in their household financial matters.

Now he is applying for an education loan to help him cover his next semester fees.

loans.use: to cover his next semester fees.

loans.name: Eliana Marcela

texts.es:
Eliana es una pujante y trabajadora ama de casa de 26 años de edad, la cual es madre de dos pequeños de 7 y 5 años de edad, vive junto con su pareja la cual tiene ingresos modestos, por dicho motivo, Eliana monto su negocio desde su hogar la cual es la cría de pollos, un negocio que le permite criar a sus muchachos y generar ingresos para complementar los gastos de su hogar.

Pero ella no quiere solo ayudar, quiere ser autosuficiente, ser competitiva, ser la mejor empresaria en turbo, comprar una vivienda, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, ser lo suficiente para sostener un hogar ella sola.

Eliana quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de sus galpones, comprar pollos, comprar cuido. Todo ello enfocado para mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad, mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Eliana is an energetic and hard-working housewife who is 26 years old. She is the mother of two small children aged seven and five and lives with her partner who earns a modest income. For this reason, Eliana has started a business from their home raising chickens. This work allows her to care for her children and make some money to add to the household earnings.

Eliana doesn't simply want to help with household costs, she wants to be self-sufficient, competitive, be a leading businesswoman, buy a home, ensure her children have the best education possible and be able to make enough to maintain her home independently.

Eliana is seeking a loan to improve the infrastructure of her chicken coops, buy chickens and chicken feed. This will help to increase her sales, maximise profitability and improve her place her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed. This will help to increase her sales, maximise profitability and improve her place her business.

loans.name: Emelicar

texts.en:
Emelicar is married and she works hard to support her family.

Emelicar has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Emelicar requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Emelicar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 37 years old, married, and has two children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, age 41, comes from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is happily married to Minerva, a businesswoman, and has two children. The couple help each other to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs and for the education of their high school child and elementary child. Mario, like many other Filipinos, puts education as a top priority on the budget, next to food.

Mario has recently opened a general store in their community. His small convenience store retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Mario has a charming and friendly personality and people prefer to buy at his store. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan that he will use to fill his store with grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles, beverages and toiletries. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Mario dreams to grow his mini store into a big grocery store. He wants to give his children the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week where he can also draw strength and inspiration from religion, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for canned goods, rice, instant noodles, beverages and toiletries to sell at his store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 37, is a married woman with six children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juliana has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Juliana requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Juliana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is now in her fourth year at the university, majoring in management and finance. She used her previous loan to pay for her third year semesters fees, and now she is applying to another loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

Dima is eager to work in her study field after getting her bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 43 years old and has three children. Marianita is married and has three children who are in school.

Marianita is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines. Marianita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marianita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Esther Julia

texts.es:
Esther es una luchadora mujer de 58 años de edad la cual se dedica a preparar alimentos, para ser más específicos, prepara tamales y morcilla, los cuales hace por encargo dado que cada solo prepara los alimentos cada quince días.

Su afán de progresar y mejorar los ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida la hacen solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos, buscando principalmente realizar sus alimentos cada semana, este es el fin del préstamo.
texts.en:
Esther is a determined 58-year-old woman who makes a living preparing food. To be specific, she makes tamales and black pudding. She makes her products to order, as she only prepares them every fortnight. 

She was motivated to ask for this loan by her desire to move forward and generate more income so that she can offer her family a better quality of life. She will use this loan to buy ingredients with a view to making her food products every week; this is the purpose of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients so she can make her food products on a weekly basis instead of fortnightly as she was doing before

loans.name: Essa Haybe

texts.en:
Essa is 25 years old and he lives in Hargiesa. He is married and has two children.

He works providing vehicle tire-pressure services. He provides service to cars and vehicles through air pressure in the tires.

Essa uses traditional vehicle tire air pressure methods, but now he needs to buy modern equipment for tire pressure to improve his services and to generate more income for his business. To do so, he requested a loan of $1,100 from Kaaba MFI.

Kaaba will purchase the modern tire pressure equipment and will give it to Essa as a loan, and Essa will then make monthly repayments. In the future, Essa wants to provide good quality vehicle tire pressure.

loans.use: to buy equipment to provide tire pressure.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe, twenty six years old from Payatas Quezon City, a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for three years now. And wife of Marvin who is a construction worker. They’re currently involved in food stall and pig farming, Because she has food stall business she also added a business of pig farming; ingredients for processed food. Pigs are a popular form of livestock since pigs are raised as human food. Maria Fe is able to run the business while taking care of his family according to her is one of the advantages.

Pig farming is exhausting since cleaning each pigs including their pig pen and feeding them are not an easy job. Moreover, feeds and vitamins are expensive. That’s why Maria Fe applied for P8, 000 as an added capital and support for the business. With this she’ll be able to buy feeds, vitamins and all of that’s necessary in pig farming.

Maria Fe is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and all of that’s necessary in pig farming.

loans.name: Kumusaraba Group

texts.fr:
Olive  fait partie du groupe  Kumusaraba et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de   50 ans. Elle a 7 enfants   âgés de 13 à 27 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  haricot  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Olive is a member of the Kumusaraba Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 50-year-old widow. She has seven children aged between 13 and 27 years old; four of them are currently attending school.

She has been selling beans for 20 years.

This will be her second loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity for beans which will be resold at a profit.

In the years to come, she would like to see her children receive an education.

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase a large quantity for beans which will be resold at a profit.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a taxi driver with many years of work experience. Using his own car, he drives a taxi in his local Gyumri town. Martin, father of a son, happily lives with his family.
Martin is enthusiastic about providing high quality and quick service to his customers, so his taxi is highly demanded in the area where he mainly works.
To be able to renovate the car engine and continue his taxi service, Martin has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan is important for Marting and his business so he hopes for lenders' faith and support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car engine to continue providing taxi service.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 29 years and she is married with four children.  They all got very excited because the school got a loan from TRM to buy machetes and spades to clear land and make gardens to grow vegetables.  They can be sold and help to run a school for children and meet their daily needs. Beatriz also raises chickens, goats, buffalo and all the animals are very helpful to run her life, because when the money is not there, Beatriz can also sell these animals

loans.use: to buy machetes and spades.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling Personal Collection products business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell for her direct selling business.

Ana Maria has been in this business for 15 years. Ana Maria earns more income from frozen foods vending and manicure/pedicure services.

Ana Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 20 years old now.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Susan has been in this business for two years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with five children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy salt and vinegar to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy salt and vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jolita

texts.en:
Ma. Jolita is a married woman with three children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jolita is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Ma. Jolita requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Jolita has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Ma. Jolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a Ugandan male living in Kagadi Uganda. He is a married man with 4 children aged between 3 and 11 years, dealing in produce buying and selling. For additional income Johnbosco does farming, serving the rural people aiming at developing himself and his family at large. He is very active in his business and is striving hard to explore the available markets and trade from the city, as he is assured of attractive prices which will increase his profits in turn. The challenge he faces is poor roads and high fuel prices leading to increased transport costs. Johnbosco intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Peterlina

texts.en:
Peterlina is a married woman with eight children. She is 66 and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Peterlina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

Peterlina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Abavandimwe Group

texts.fr:
Lin fait partie du groupe  Abandimwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Médiatrice, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  d’un  an.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de l'huile de palme  depuis  15 ans. 

Il est à son huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de palmier à huile pour la production de l’huile de palme  à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des terres  pour la culture de riz, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Lin is a member of the Abandimwe Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and married to Médiatrice, a farmer. Together, they have a one-year-old child. They also have two children from their extended family living under their care, both of whom are currently attending school. 

He has been selling palm oil for 15 years.

This will be his eight loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and purchase many oil palms in order to produce palm oil which will be resold at a profit

In the years to come, he would like to purchase land for growing rice. He also wants to see his children receive an education.

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase many oil palms in order to produce palm oil which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 40-years-old married man from Rafah city. He is a teacher and he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

He wants to take his Master's degree and develop his job to help his family.
Wisam took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his work and study. By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to do his home work and reports. He also can prepare the exams and other programs for his students easily. Wisam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work and study.

loans.name: Carmenchu

texts.en:
Carmenchu works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Carmenchu requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, meat, vegetables, flour, cream, etc. for her food production business.

Carmenchu has been in this business for 31 years now.

Carmenchu would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, meat, vegetables, flour, cream, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia es una empresaria de 42 años de edad, humilde, trabajadora, responsable, aplicada y cumplida que durante un tiempo estuvo trabajando la confección a terceros pero siempre deseando sacar su propia línea de ropa, pues bueno este es el momento porque, al momento de acudir a interactuar buscando un  crédito encontró un sí, y ahora está entidad le ofrece la posibilidad de unirse a la comunidad Kiva, donde hay muchos prestatarios interesados en su progreso y en que impulse esa línea de confección propia para que genere mayores ingresos.
Claudia desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas, con las que confeccionara, lencería, pijamas y ropa interior.
texts.en: Claudia is a 42 year old businesswoman. She is humble, hard-working, responsible, diligent and thoughtful, and was working with a third party dressmaker but always wanted to have her own clothing line. But now is the time because she went to Interactuar looking for a loan and received a "yes". Now this organization is offering her the possibility of coming together with the Kiva community, where there are lots of lenders interested in her progress and in her boosting her clothing line so that she can get more earnings. Claudia wants to ask for a loan to buy fabrics, which she will use to make lingerie, pajamas, and underwear.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, which she will use to make lingerie, pajamas, and underwear.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is math teacher working at a local school in Gyumri town for many years. Her daughter is married and lives separately and Gohar is with her son, husband and mother-in-law.
After her work ends at school, Gohar receives students in her house and provides them with individual courses in math.
She has no separate room for working with her students and it is very difficult. Gohar asks this loan to purchase chairs, a desk and cabinet and also a laptop for a better organized teaching process. This loan will be a big support for Gohar's work as a teacher.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, a desk and cabinet and also a laptop for better organized teaching process.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 26 years old single man who lives in Irbid, a city in northern Jordan. Husam is enrolled in one of the public universities in southern Jordan. Husam visits his family every weekend if it is possible, as he cannot afford going home every day.

He is now in his fourth year majoring in Business Administration and is looking forward to finding a job in his field of study after graduation. Husam is applying for a loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his fourth year semester fees in Business Administration

loans.name: Gavharbi

texts.en:
Gavharbi is a kind woman, with two children and was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in a remote district with her family. She became a widow 10 years ago. She is a generous, clever, patient and confident person. Her profession is a teacher. She teaches history and law students at secondary school. She has many years of experience of teaching.

Besides being a teacher, she tries to be a tailor. She sews traditional women clothes. She has permanent orders and satisfied clients. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan because both her children are studying at university. Her finances are not enough to pay her children's tuition fees. She requested a loan from Kiva to pay the tuition fees. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.name: Nilto Cesar

texts.es:
NILTO TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON CONYUGE E HIJO.DESDE HACE MAS DE 20 AÑOS. EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU. ES UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA.

NILTO SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE CONSTRUCCION, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI Y ANEXOS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 08 AÑOS,CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS LABORALES Y PERSONALES. NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION, TALES COMO MADERA, CARRETILLAS, ANDAMIOS, ENTRE OTROS. DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ MEJORAR SUS NIVELES DE INGRESOS Y POR ENDE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Nilto is 39 years old. He has lived in his own house with his partner and son for more than 20 years. He lives in the district of Cayalti, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the Northern coast of Peru. The people in his community make a living in business, agriculture and livestock.

Nilto has made a living in construction, in the district of Cayalti and Anexos, for more than 8 years, and has many good work and personal references.

He needs the loan to invest into buying construction materials, such as wood, trucks, scaffolding, and others. This way he can improve his income level and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as wood, trucks, scaffolding, and others.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old. He is married and has four children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for last six years.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, salt etc. for the shop. 

He will use the profit from his business to educate his children and expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow and stabilize the business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour and salt for the shop

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and has three children. Wilma is married and has three children who are in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 28-year-old woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Her two children are in school.

Riza has a fishing business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies.

Riza has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Heronima

texts.en:
Michael is 19 years old and is 1st of the three children in the family. His mother Heronima supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Michael is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Heronima is borrowing Php 6,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Michael for the First Semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Michael plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay her son's first year tuition fees in Criminology

loans.name: Monica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mónica es una carismática joven de 19 años de edad, una mujer pujante verraca, noble, es casada y tiene un pequeño de 2 meses de edad.

Mónica trabaja ofertando servicios de cibercafé, un negocio que empezó en el año 2014 como necesidad económica, buscando principalmente progresar y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

La sostenibilidad de su negocio es su principal preocupación ya que con los precios que grandes operadores ofrecen en los hogares, el internet se ha vuelto más asequible, por ello quiere buscar un plan b para mantener su negocio y atraer público joven, pero para ello necesita capital, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de consolas Xbox y televisores, creando una nueva línea de servicios que serán los videojuegos.
texts.en:
Mónica is a charismatic young woman, 19 years old, a strong force of nature, noble, married and has a little one, 2 months old. 

Mónica works offering internet cafe services, a business which she began in the year 2014 by economic necessity, seeking primarily to progress and to support her husband with the household expenses. 

The sustainability of her business is her principle concern since, with the prices that the big operators offer in home, the internet has become more accessible, so she wants to look for a Plan B to maintain her business and attract the young public. But, for this, she needs capital, so she is asking for a loan to purchase Xbox consoles and televisions, creating a new service line which will be video games.

loans.use: to expand her service offerings, offering entertainment with video game consoles.

loans.name: Doris De Jesus

texts.es:
Salir de la pobreza, construir un sólido futuro para su familia son las metas que se ha propuesto la señora Doris quien a sus 52 años de edad trabaja de lunes a sábado 5 horas diarias en su negocio de venta de alimentos.

Doris sale estos días a empujar su carro de comidas por toda la zona comercial de Apartadó y tiene la esperanza que con este humilde negocio, poniéndole ganas, perseverancia, todo su empeño lo sacara adelante y le dará grandes oportunidades a esa pequeña de 14 años que tanto ama (su hija).

Doris quiere solicitar un préstamo para terminar de pagar su carro de alimentos, comprar dos termos para albergar mayores sabores de jugo y surtido de frutas y abarrotes para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Getting out of poverty and building a solid future for her family are the goals that Doris has proposed. She is 52 years old and works Monday to Saturday, 5 hours a day in her business selling food.

Doris goes out on these days to push her food cart around the business area of Apartadó. She has the hope that with this humble business, putting in effort, perseverance, and all of her might, she will succeed and it will give her great opportunities for her 14 year old daughter, who she dearly loves.

She wants to ask for a loan to finish paying off her food cart, buy two thermoses to harbor better juice flavors, and buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables to make her foods.

loans.use: to pay off her food cart, buy two thermoses to harbor better juice flavors, and buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables to make her foods.

loans.name: Paola Karina

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer cabeza de familia de 31 años de edad, que con empuje y verraquera ha motivado a su familia y la impulsada hacia adelante, solo con un humilde negocio de venta de ganado porcino, el cual ha significado un cambio gigante en la mentalidad de su familia, están creyendo en mejores posibilidades, en que si se pueda lograr lo soñado y es el gran aliciente de esta mujer.
Está mujer quiere seguir con su trabajo y ahora necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, cerdos, alimento, vitaminas, con los que seguirá potenciando su actividad y llevándola al éxito.
texts.en:
Paola is the female head of the household at 31 years old. With drive and tenacity, she has motivated her family and has driven them forward just with a humble business selling swine. He has caused a huge change in the mentality of her family. They are believing in better possibilities, in if they can achieve their dreams, and it is a great incentive for this woman.

She wants to keep going with her job and now she needs an economic boost to buy chickens, pigs, food, and vitamins, which she will use to continue developing her business and taking it towards success.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, food, and vitamins, which she will use to continue developing her business and taking it towards success.

loans.name: Sandra Yolima

texts.es:
Ella es Sandra es una mujer sonriente, entusiasta que labora des deus hogar vendiendo mercancía como zapatos y bolsos, una actividad que busco para cubrir una necesidad en su barrio, ofreciéndoles estos productos con facilidad, dándoles formas de pagos, variedad, garantía y buenos precios.

Sandra inicio la actividad por necesidad económica y la trabaja de dos maneras, mantiene mercancía en su casa para exhibir, pero igualmente hace labor de calle, vendiendo por diferentes zonas para ganar clientes.

Su gran sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener la casa de sus sueños y luchar por permanecer en el mercado.
Sandra quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra se surtido al por mayor de bolsos y calzados, su principal objetivo
texts.en:
This is Sandra. She is a smiling and enthusiastic woman who works from her home selling merchandise like shoes and bags. She started this business to meet a need in her community. She offers these products with ease, giving them ways to pay, variety, a guarantee, and good prices. 

Sandra started her business due to financial necessity and she works in two ways. She keeps merchandise in her home to display, but she also works as a street vendor, selling in different neighborhoods to gain more customers. 

Her biggest dream is to improve the conditions of her home, have the home of her dreams, and strive to remian in the market. Sandra wants to request a loan to buy wholesale stock like bags and shoe as her main objective.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale like bags and shoes.

loans.name: Katherin Juliet

texts.es:
Katherine es una hermosa joven de 24 años de edad la cual tiene un sueño prestar servicios de catering en eventos empresariales, pero para ello necesita saber cocinar, diplomas, herramientas, formación empresarial y todo ello lo encuentra en Interactuar, una entidad que no solo ofrece créditos, también ofrece servicios de desarrollo empresarial, entre ellos capacitación motivo por el cual La joven se encuentra solicitando un préstamo y es que quiere pagar una técnica en cocina para tener la formación necesaria para cumplir su sueño el cual ha tenido desde pequeña, sintiendo siempre gran pasión por la cocina.
Anímate, apoya a esta futura empresaria que hoy te necesita para poder formarse y perseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Katherine is a lovely young woman, 24 years old, who has a dream of offering catering services to business events, but for this she needs to know how to cook, have certificates, tools, business training and all this she finds in Interactuar, an entity that not only offers loans, but also offers business development services, among them the training for which the young woman is asking for a loan. She wants to pay for a technical course in cooking to have the training necessary to achieve her dream which she has had since she was little, having always had a passion for cooking. 

Come on, support this future businesswoman who today needs you to be able to get training and pursue her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for a technical course in cooking; she wants to have her own business in the future.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en:
Claudina is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin).She is married and is 31 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as biscuits,sugar, salt, coffee, eggs, candles, noodles,slippers, salt and water. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
Claudina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. And she is happy because TRM offered a loan to improve her living condition in the future. Her husband is a teacher.and also he has animals such as chickens, pigs and goats.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar, salt, coffee, eggs, candles, noodles, slippers, salt and water.

loans.name: Jlg-008-Pudhupalyam Group

texts.en:
Saroja is the mother of 4 children. To support her family, she works as a daily wage labourer in addition to managing the household. Her family is dependent on agriculture for sustenance. She earns enough to manage the daily expenses at home but she spends a considerable amount of Rs 600 on medical expenses every month. She feels that building a toilet at home would drastically reduce that.

The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Saroja leads a group of 3 living in Kulithalai that has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But they do not have the means to build one. With no access to a toilet, their families have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. Their women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to fund the installation of toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. Filomena is married and she opened her second hand shop in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy trousers, shorts, shirts, long sleeves and short sleeve. Filomena is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Filomena is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it will improve living conditions in the future,

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, shirts, long sleeves and short sleeves.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Doormat making and salted dried split fish business are the source of income of Fernanda. She is 48 years old and lives in Camarin Caloocan City. At the start of the day, first she prepares the ingredients to make salted dried split fish or in the Philippines it’s called “Daing” which Filipinos really love to eat. While waiting on the fish drying process, Fernanda then make doormats at home with variety of designs and sizes. Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends.

Fernanda is married to Gilbert, a jeepney driver. Together they work hand in hand to earn income for their day-to-day expenses. Fernanda wants to make more doormats and produce more dried fish in the market however capital is what she’s needing. With this, she decided to apply for a loan of Php 9,000. To have added capital and buy necessary materials for making doormats and as well ingredients in making dried fish.

Fernanda regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to have added capital and to buy the necessary materials for making doormats and also ingredients for making dried fish.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is happy that she has twice accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. Her loans have certainly helped maintain her tricycle and thus provide means to meet their daily needs.

Olivia is again humbly asking for an 8000 PHP loan to pay for her tricycle's registration, tire replacement and gas to ensure safe and efficient service of her transportation business. Her tricycle means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past seven years.

Olivia's simple dream is to maintain her service and acquire one more tricycle unit. She prays for God's abundance in all areas and to be able to assist her children financially. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina’s previous loan with CCT really helped her plastics buying and selling business. She was able to buy a large quantity and variety of plastics and resell them to become reusable and turned into profit. Though profit is not that drastic compared to other businesses, still hard work and patience are her strengths and allow her to run the business and support her family.

Agustina believes in the saying “May pera sa basura” or “There’s money in junk”. It is a job without days-off where your hands get dirty just to make a profit.

Like any other business, Agustina wants to expand her businesses. She also aims to invest for properties, save money for their future, continue to support her children’s education and provide for her family needs. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the bases for business success to take place. That’s why Agustina decided to apply for a PHP 31,000 loan this year that will be used as an added capital to buy a large quantity of scrap material not just plastic but other varieties like metal, steel, cardboard and glass.

Agustina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 51 years old and has four children. Florencia is married and has two children who are still in school.

Florencia is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Florencia has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 42 years old, married and has two children with one child in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business farming root crops in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Teodora has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Ella es Natalia, es una mujer de 26 años de edad residente de la zona de sonson, una tierra pujante llena de personas como Natalia que con emprendimiento y trabajo honesto, hacen de este municipio uno de los más hermosos y atractivos.

Natalia se dedica a la cría de pollos y venta de huevos, con esta actividad sostiene a su familia y en especial le brinda todo lo que está a su alcance a su pequeña de 5 años de edad.

Su mayor sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y para ello está colocando todo su empeño y esfuerzo, pero no lo puede lograr con los ingresos que tiene en el momento tiene que buscar hacer crecer su empresa, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 30 pollos, alimento al por mayor y madera para la construcción de un nuevo galpón para albergar los nuevos animales.
texts.en:
This is Natalia. She is a 26 year old woman and lives in the area of Sonson. It is a thriving area full of people like Natalia, who, with entrepreneurship and honest work, make this town one of the most beautiful and attractive.

Natalia makes a living raising chickens and selling eggs. With this job, she supports her family and it especially gives her little 5 year old daughter everything that is in her reach.

Her biggest dream is to be able to pay her children's education and all of her commitment and effort is going towards that. But she can't achieve that with the earnings that she is getting at the moment. She has to look to growing her business, so she is asking for a loan to buy 30 chickens, wholesale food, and wood to build a new barn to house the new animals.

loans.use: to buy 30 chickens, wholesale food, and wood to build a new barn to house the new animals.

loans.name: Fausto Alexander

texts.es:
Fausto es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, una persona aguerrida y trabajadora, se desempeña a cultivar café, una actividad que realiza 8 horas diarias, aprendió y heredó el negocio de su familia, su padre desde muy joven lo llevaba a los campos y le explicaba del negocio familiar, hoy en día Fausto es quien maneja las riendas del cultivo y es el encargado de generar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Fausto trabaja por un sueño el cual es comprar una vivienda propia, ya que aparte de mantener el cultivo familiar, quiere tener uno propio y así hacer el legado familiar más amplió.

Para la sostenibilidad el negocio, ampliación del cultivo y creación de estrategias para alzar el precio del café, Fausto necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, venenos y un pago de mano de obra para la labor de fertilización y preparación de terreno y proceso de siembra.
texts.en:
Fausto is a 29-year-old single man, a courageous and hard-working person. He works growing coffee, work he does for 8 hours each day, he learned and inherited the business from his family. When he was very young, his father would bring him to the fields and explain the family business to him. These days, Fausto is who is at the reins of the cultivation and he is in charge of generating the resources needed to sustain his family.

Fausto works for a dream, which is to purchase his own house, since apart from maintaining the family crops, he wants to have his own and, so, to make a larger family legacy. 

To make his business sustainable, expand the cultivation and create strategies to raise the price of coffee, Fausto needs a loan to purchase supplies, fertilizers, pesticides, and pay labor costs for the work of fertilizing and preparing the land and sowing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs for the work of fertilizing and preparing the land and sowing.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un sonriente y orgulloso campesino residente de la zona de Betulia, que es, una tierra pujante llena de personas trabajadoras y honestas, entre ellos Walter quien con su cultivo de café genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Vive junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos, su mayor sueño es tener una unidad productiva, firme y sostenible en el tiempo, dejarles el negocio a sus hijos y que estos continúen sosteniendo sus familias con el cultivo de café.

Walter en su negocio emplea a dos personas, principalmente cuando está en época de fertilización, de preparación de tierra y recolección de cultivo.

Walter necesita un liento económico para comprar insumos y pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento de sus campos, dichos insumos serán parte fundamental en la próxima cosecha, ya que la cosecha será más abundante y de calidad.
texts.en:
Walter is a smiling and proud rural worker, who lives in Betulia zone which is a powerful land full of hard-working and honest people, among them Walter who, with his coffee crop, generates the income to sustain his family. 

He lives with his partner and their three children, his biggest dream is to have a business which is productive, firm and sustainable over time, and to leave the business to his children so they continue supporting their families with coffee growing. 

Walter employs two people in his business, principally when it is the time for fertilization, to prepare the land, and collecting the harvest.

Walter needs a loan to purchase supplies and to pay for labor costs to maintain his fields, these supplies will be a fundamental part of the next harvest, since the harvest will be more abundant and of better quality.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay for labor costs to maintain his fields; these supplies will be a fundamental part of the next harvest.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 38 years old married woman and a mother. Starting a family did not stop her from following her dreams in getting her bachelor degree,. She enrolled in a private college to major in pharmacy. She wants to open her own pharmacy after graduation.

Having a family and its financial responsibilities puts her education sometimes on hold, but now Areej decided to take out an education loan to cover her next semester fees so she can graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to cover her next semester fees for a B. Sc. in Pharmacy

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 37, is a married woman who has three dependent children; they are all in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province. The only main source of the family’s income is from working as a construction worker, and she has been in this business for years. She can earn only 34,800 KHR per day to support the family’s needs.

This is Heang's fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has paid back past loans completely. The past loans enabled her to improve the living conditions and provide timely support of the family’s needs.

In a group of two members, Heang is the leader and she will use her loan to buy construction materials to support her business.

She hopes to earn more income to buy more household supplies for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen repairs radio equipments, mobile phones and other electronic devices in the center of Gyumri town.
He lives and works in the same town with his parents. Karen rents a small store, where he can receive different orders from his clients.

He has now applied for this loan to purchase some components needed for his work as a electronical equipment repairman. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Karen hopes to receive lenders' support and invest in his business that provides basic income to his family.

loans.use: to pay for some components needed for his work as a electronical equipment repairman.

loans.name: Maydee

texts.en:
Maydee is a widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maydee has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Maydee requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to resell.

Maydee has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maydee would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Clarena Maria

texts.es:
Clarena es una joven de 19 años de edad, la cual tiene una cafetería, como ven en la foto su negocio se está decayendo, tiene poco surtido y sus clientes cada vez son menos, ella no renuncia a su negocio quiere convertirlo en algo bueno y rentable, que se sostenga y le permita generar ingresos para mantener a su familia, no le queda de otra, tiene que buscar como engrandecer ese negocio ya que las oportunidades laborales para jóvenes sin experiencia son pocas.

Clarena solicita tu apoyo, un impulso para tener capital de trabajo para abastecer su negocio, ella se compromete a trabajar con empeño si es necesario largos jornadas laborales para levantar su negocio y convertirlo en el más popular del barrio.
texts.en:
Clarena is a 19-year-old young woman who has a cafe. As seen in the photo, the business is declining, it has little stock and her customers are decreasing. She doesn't give up her business, she wants to convert it into something profitable, which supports her and allows her to generate income to support her family. She doesn't have another option; she has to look for how to expand this business since work opportunities for young people without experience are few. 

Clarena asks for your support, a boost to have working capital to stock her business. She promises to work with determination and, if necessary, long work days, to lift up her business and make it the most popular in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock her business

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Aged 51, Bopha is a farmer and a married mother who resides with her two children in Kratie province. She has been growing rice for 20 years as the main source of family’s income and working for others for a fee is the supplemental income. Being under the threat of drought and insufficient organic fertilizers to support her farming, the rice crop produced last season was lower than her expected-outputs.

Now, Bopha leads a group which comprises of two members to apply for the new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the third time for her, which she paid back past loan completely. She has wisely managed those past loans to improve the living standard. As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee, buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields. She hopes to increase income so as to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 20-year-old student who lives in one of Irbid’s neighborhoods. He couldn’t enroll into a university because of financial problems, but found an institution that gives diploma degrees in the major he wants to study which is web-design. 

At the same time, to be able to afford the fees or what the school needs or even his pocket money he works at a car rental company. He is now applying for a loan to help him in paying the tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Abdelelah

texts.en:
Abdelelah is a young man who is studying at one of the public universities in the south. He is majoring in Chemical Engineering. His father had to find another job after retirement from the military, as the retirement salary was not enough to support the family.

Now he has managed to pay for the semester fees only, so he is applying for a loan to buy the needed books and to pay for the dorm fees, as he is staying there during the week and visits his family on weekends to save the transportation money.

loans.use: to buy needed books for his B. Sc. in Chemical Engineering and to pay for the dorm fees.

loans.name: Razinita

texts.en:
Razinita is a married woman, 51, with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Razinita has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell to her customers.

Razinita has been in this business for 5 years. Razinita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, married and has had five children. She is selling vegetables to gain income for living.

She wants to increase her earnings by selling more vegetables. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to use in expanding her business. She will buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and beans to sell.

In the future, she hopes to keep improving her sales to earn more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and has six children. Teresita is married and has two children who are still in school.
