Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 28 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Janice requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Janice has been in this business for 3 years now.

Janice would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a 43-year-old married woman taking care of 7 children all of school-going age. She has a liquor store in Kagadi, Uganda, a business she has done for the last 12 years.

With the support of her husband she has been able to grow her business. She is a hardworking woman who plans to start up a retail shop and educate her children to University level in future.

Sauda is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elita Isabel

texts.es:
Ella es Elita, es una mujer muy humilde y necesitada, madre de 5 niños los cuales ama y quiere generar un buen futuro y no tengan que vivir bajos las condiciones donde están actualmente, por ello pide su ayuda, no quiere  una limosna, necesita un préstamo, uno que usara en la compra de ollas, recipientes, cucharones e insumos para iniciar a preparar alimentos. 

Elita quiere forjar con sus propias manos un futuro para sus muchachos, por ello el préstamo es para crear una empresa, si la apoyas, ayudaría a una mujer necesitada la cual quiere en señal de agradecimiento, cumplir con sus fechas de pago y triunfar, tener un restaurante y agradecerles en un futuro por el apoyo que pueda recibir.
texts.en:
Elita is a very humble woman in need. She is a mother to five children whom she loves; she wants to give them a good future, where they will not have to live in the conditions they do now. Therefore, Elita is asking for your help. She does not want a handout but needs a loan, which she will use to buy pots and pans, ladles, and ingredients to begin preparing food.

Elita wants to build a future for her boys and this loan is so that she can create a business. If you support Elita, you will be helping a woman in need. In appreciation, she wants to meet her payment dates, succeed, and have her own restaurant; in the future she will always be grateful for the support she received.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans, ladles, and ingredients to begin preparing food.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place depuis le 18 Septembre 2013. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maimouna (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de poissons fumés qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 paniers de 50 kg à 700f le kg et après épuisement du stock le renouveler.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la prise en charge de sa famille (habillements, soins médicaux habillement etc.…)
texts.en:
This group started since the 18th of September, 2013. It is made up of women who are determined to change their living conditions. They all live in the same village and have strong relationships based on solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is petty trade.
Mrs Maimouna (standing on the right with a hand raised) is the featured group borrower. She is thirty-seven years old, married and mother to four children. Her job is the sale of smoked fish which she buys at the weekly markets to resell on a retail basis. With this loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg baskets at 700f per kg and to replenish this stock when it is finished. The earnings will go towards taking care of her family (clothing, medical care, etc).

loans.use: to purchase three 50-kg baskets of smoked fish at 700f per kg, and to replenish this stock when finished.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 18 Septembre 2013 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint son quatrième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Binta (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre en détails

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 01 sac de sucre à 25000f et 20 litres d’huile à 14000f pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charges de certains besoins familiaux (soins médicaux et scolarités des enfants) et aussi d’augmenter son épargne au sein du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This rural bank was created on 18th September 2013 when it was inaugurated. Since then the group has reached its fourth cycle in the rural bank program. The women support one another and, by working together, have developed a solidarity and a group spirit which is praised by the village elders. Their main activity is petty trade.
Mrs Binta (standing at the extreme right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is forty-two years old and mother to seven children. She retails food products that she purchases at weekly markets. This new loan will allow her to purchase one bag of sugar at 25000f and 20 litres of oil at 14000f for retail. The earnings will allow her to participate in taking care of certain family needs (medical care and children's schooling) and also to increase her savings at the rural bank.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of sugar at 25000f and 20 litres of oil at 14000f to retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen started a direct selling business in March.  She offers Avon products, as well as boardwalk and second-hand clothes.  She is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to increase her stock of goods and her income.  She will use the loan to buy shoes, cosmetic products, and personal hygiene products for her direct selling business.  She believes that, with additional capital, she can improve her standard of living and generate more income to support her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as shoes, cosmetic products, and personal hygiene products, for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a 53-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gleceria has a business where she buys and sells coco lumber in the Philippines. Gleceria requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of coco lumber to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gleceria has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of coco lumber to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Jenalyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Una guerrera de mil batallas, así es Ana Isabel, una mujer que no se deja vencer pro las adversidades y que busca medios para tratar sus problemas. Ella es madre de dos muchachos, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo, una zona humilde donde escasean las oportunidades laborales, al tener dificultades económicos, optó por tomar el camino del emprendimiento, donde necesita tu apoyo para poder crear un negocio, uno de venta de venta de mercancía, donde comercializara principalmente ropa interior, juegos de sabanas y toallas en volumen, todo ello va muy enfocado en su necesidad y quiere perseguir su sueño de comprar una vivienda para dejarle una buena herencia a sus muchachos.
texts.en: A fighter of a thousand battles--that's Ana Isabel, a woman who doesn't give up in the face of adversity and always searches for solutions to her problems. She is the mother of two children, and lives in the township of Sincelejo, a humble area with few labor opportunities. When faced with economic hardship, she decided to take an entrepreneurial path, and needs your support to start up a business selling merchandise, mainly undergarments, sheet sets and towels in large quantities; she is very focused on her necessity and wants to pursue her dream of buying a home and leaving a nice inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to start a business selling undergarments, sheet sets and towels in large quantities.

loans.name: Edgar De Jesus

texts.es:
Muchas personas en el mundo disfrutan el sabor de un café, y personas como Edgar, cultivadores verracos y pujantes que están trabajando desde la primer hora del día por hacer posible que una persona disfrute de su café y ellos puedan generar recursos para mantener a sus seres amados.

Ahora Edgar necesita de tu apoyo, de tu ayuda para seguir realizando está actividad, un préstamo que le ayudaría a comprar insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos tales como; insecticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes y además pagara mano de obra para aplicar estos insumos.

Apoya a los nobles agricultores, ya que gracias a su labor, pueden disfrutar un sano producto.
texts.en:
Many people around the world enjoy the flavor of coffee. Edgar is one of the strong and hardworking growers who start their work early in the morning to make that cup of coffee possible. They do this so that they can earn the income they need to support their loved ones.

Now Edgar needs your support to continue with his work. He needs a loan that will help him buy agricultural supplies to maintain his crops (insecticides, fungicides, and fertilizer) and pay the workers who will apply these things.

With your support, these noble farmers, thanks to their hard work, can produce a healthy crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like insecticides, fungicides, and fertilizer, and also to pay the workers who will apply these things.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 32-year-old, single man from Khanyounis.  He lives with his family in a simple house.  Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Jaber started his own business a few years ago.  He manages a stall where he sells toys.

This is the only source of income for his family.  Jaber took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN).  This loan will help him buy a new collection of children's toys for his stall.  This will increase his sales and also his income.  (Jaber appears in the photo)

loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's toys for his stall.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino tiene 68 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Cristino vive con su cónyugue y sus hijos, en el distrito de Sallique, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la agricultura, así como al comercio en general y ganaderia.

Cristino se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados, tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado de abastos de Sallique, en el cual ya tiene 04 años en dicho puesto el cual es propio.Cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro, además Cristino se dedica a la agricultura en su caserío, y él cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de mesas, sillas, cubiertos, entre otros, para poder aumentar su producción y asi cumplir con toda la demanda insatisfeca y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristino is 68 years old, he has a partner and two dependent children. Cristino lives with his partner and two children in the district of Sallique, in the province of Jaen, in the Cajamarca area, in Peru's northern sierra. The people mainly work in agriculture, commercial business and raising livestock.
Crstino sells prepared foods. He has a stall in a market in Sallique, which he owns and has had for four years. He has extensive experience in this area, in addition Cristino grows crops on his land, and he has excellent personal, professional, and financial references. This loan will be used to invest in his business buying more tables, chairs, and tablecloths, among other things, in order to increase his production and satisfy the unmet demand, boost profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: invest in his business buying more tables, chairs, and tablecloths, among other things.

loans.name: Mercenario

texts.en:
If you go to the Philippines maybe you’ll hear one unusual business type; it’s called a sari-sari store. It’s a small type of convenience store and a Tagalog word which means “variety”. Items here are bought by wholesale however they’re selling the products by piece, per kilo or by volume. Products are sometimes on tables or it has grills or a screen for protection against theft. Foods that are ready to eat such as biscuits, breads, junk foods and such are hanging on the grills to attract customers. You can even buy one candy for P1.00--that’s how cheap products are in a sari-sari store. It can be found anywhere in the country, in barrios, barangays, municipalities and cities.

Though competition is drastic on this line of business, Mercenario was encouraged to pursue his own store. The daily profit is just enough for their day-to-day expenditures. Dedication and perseverance are the qualities that he has. That’s why the business is still growing. Moreover, he is grateful that CCT granted his previous loan of Php 20,000. The amount was used to buy additional items for his food stall and sari-sari store. This year, Mercenario applied for another loan of Php 30,000 since he wants to have products in stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add on to his sari-sari store business.

Mercenario is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares his own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have products on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add to his sari-sari store business

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Dyna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Dyna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Annie Lyn

texts.en:
Annie Lyn is 47 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Annie Lyn works very hard to provide for them.

Annie Lyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Annie Lyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Annie Lyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en: Domingos is married and has five children (three boys and two girls, all of whom are in school).  He took a $1,000 loan from Tuba Rai Metin to restore his house because it is very important for his family.  He took the loan to buy cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman who is currently selling vegetables as well as being involved in a business buying and selling personal products. After managing those for almost 7 years, Jocelyn admits that she still needs guidance in making the business grow. With this, she takes advantage whenever there are seminars for entrepreneurs conducted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

She’s grateful that aside from the seminars, they were able to approve her previous loan and she is grateful to the lenders who provided the amount which made a vast impact on the business. The amount was used to buy necessities for the business.

Jocelyn wants to add products to her current businesses. Aside from direct selling of personal products and vegetables vending, she wants to add grocery items as well. Basically, she is aiming to manage a sari-sari store business. It is a tagalog word which means “variety”. It is a smaller version of a convenience store but the price is much cheaper since items are being measured by kilos, volume or by piece.

With this, Jocelyn is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan this year to start even just a small variety store. By determination and perseverance she believes that the business will grow and indeed, with the help of God. She’s hoping that her request will be approved by CCT to have added capital for the new business.

Jocelyn is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from other members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products, such as coffee, toothpaste, soap and other personal products, that she sells.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alma is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Alma has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted slippers to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted slippers to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jessica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jessica has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Kapan, where he lives with his wife.  Two years ago, he purchased a car using credit and started a taxi driving service in his town.  When he first earned income from the service, Hovhannes was able to improve his and his wife's living conditions.

He has now applied for this loan to pay for gas installation on the car and to make a final credit repayment on the car.  The gas installation will give Hovhannes an opportunity to decrease operational costs (gas is the cheapest fuel in Armenia) and to pay off the credit balance.
 
Hovhannes has been approved for a loan through a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products.  Hovhannes is sure that the partnership with Kiva will be successful, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for gas installation on his taxi and to make a final credit repayment on the taxi.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala, 28, is a differently-abled married woman from a small town of Khurda district. She lives with her husband who has a transport business and two beautiful kids who are currently studying in primary school.

Nirmala studied up to the fifth grade but did not continue studying due to low economic resources. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family with a good lifestyle.

She is requesting a loan amount of 35,000 INR to Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use the loan amount and her savings in order to purchase a new vehicle for her husband's transportation business. The old vehicles are in a precarious condition due to long years of usage.

Nirmala is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting for the same.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer luchadora, alentada, muy recursiva la cual monto un negocio de cría de ganado de cerdos, actividad que empezó por necesidad económica, buscando recursos para alimentar a sus dos hijos.

Para Liliana su negocio es muy valioso, le tiene gran afecto ya que este le ayudo a salir de las difíciles situaciones y quiere continuar realizando dicha actividad y generar buenas oportunidades para sus hijos en un futuro.

Liliana en el momento busca la sostenibilidad y sostenimiento de su negocio pero no tiene el capital suficiente para lograrlo, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, pollos, vacunas, vitaminas y alimento en grandes cantidades (para animales).
texts.en:
Liliana is a tenacious, determined, and very resourceful woman. She set up a business of raising pigs. She started this business activity out of financial need while looking for resources to feed her two children. For Liliana it is a very valuable business. She has great affection for it because it helped her to get out of difficult situations. She wants to continue doing this activity and generate good opportunities for her children in the future.

Liliana is now seeking sustainability and sustainability of her business. However, she does not have enough capital to achieve this. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens, vaccinations, vitamins, and feed (for animals) in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, vaccinations, vitamins, and feed (for animals) in large quantities.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti, 46, hails from a small village of Sambalpur district, Odisha,India. She is a very industrious and enterprising person who never leaves any stone unturned to achieve her goals. She is a widow and lives with her two sons who are grown-up.

Shanti is a farmer by profession and is engaged in cultivating paddy and potatoes in her field. She earns a good amount of money after her harvested crop is sold in the market. Unfortunately, she lacks a toilet in her home and faces a lot of difficulty to go outside the field to attend nature's call due to her old age.

Therefore, Shanti is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet in her house so that she no more will have to face difficulties and can maintain health and hygiene.

Shanti dreams of marrying off her sons and seeing them succeed in their life.

loans.use: to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo is grateful that he has a number of times received loans and has promptly paid back all of those loans. It definitely helped fund maintenance of his jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service thus continuous income to meet his family's needs.

Karlo trusts that he can again request for a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration, seat cover and fuel of his jeepney service. It is important that his transportation business will continue to adequately provide for their daily needs and fund the education of his children. He is thanking God for faithfully supporting his livelihood.

Karlo dreams of acquiring more jeepneys to grow his transportation business. He aims to give his family a better quality of life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the annual registration, fuel and seat cover of his jeepney.

loans.name: Rokhy Amadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 18 Septembre 2013 et est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et habitant toute le même village et exerçant comme principale activité le petit commerce.
 
Madame Rokhy Amadou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants (04 garçons et 01 fille). Elle  s’active dans l’agriculture.
 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs d’engrais à 6000f le sac pour mettre dans ses champs et en fin d’hivernage vendre ses récoltes en détails.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte faire de l’embouche, aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et assister ses enfants en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
This group was launched on the 18th of September 2013 and is made up of members with good social cohesion who all live in the same village and primarily carry out petty trade.
Mrs Rokhy Amadou (seated at the extreme right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of five children (four boys and one girl). She works in agriculture. With this loan, she intends to buy four bags of fertiliser at 6000f per bag to use in her fields. At the end of the rainy season she will retail her harvest. With her earnings, she intends to fatten her livestock, help her husband with daily expenses and assist her children in case of need.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertiliser at 6000f per bag to put in her fields, she will retail her harvest at the end of the rainy season.

loans.name: Ma. Emerita

texts.en:
Ma. Emerita is 42 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Ma. Emerita works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Emerita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Emerita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

In the future, Ma. Emerita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, to sell.

loans.name: Macresia

texts.en:
Macresia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her food vending business.

Macresia has been in this business for 5 years. Macresia earns additional income from general store.

Macresia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her food production business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Elena has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Dominica works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dominica is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her dried fish vending business.

Dominica has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, pipes, iron, and paint, etc. in order to have raw material to make doors, windows, and balconies.

loans.name: Santoshini

texts.en:
Santoshini, 38, is a married lady with one daughter. She works with her husband in the field - he is a farmer. They grow various types of green leafy vegetables and sell them at the market and earn their livelihood.

Santoshini is a very humble and simple lady and is well-known in her locality due to her good behaviour. Unfortulately, due to lack of financial resources she was unable to provide toilet facilities to her family and this is her biggest regret.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to Kiva's partner, People's Forum to build a hygienic toilet for her family and promote cleanliness and safety in the community. She dreams of having her only daughter in a good and well-settled house in the coming years.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província Inhambane tem 35 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 1 filha menor de idade que frequenta escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É negociante faz conta própria a mais de 9 anos, onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku para adquirir mercadoria como: feijão e amendoim.
Futuramente pretende continuar com os seus estudos e garantir o ensino da sua filha até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é ter um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Aide was born in Massinga, in the Province of Inhambane. She's 35 years old, single and the mother of a daughter who is still a minor and goes to school. She isn't responsible for anyone else.

She's been a self-employed trader for more than 9 years and she spends the money she makes on household expenses. This is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku, which she will use to buy products to resell such as beans and peanuts.

In future she plans to continue with her studies and guarantee her daughter's education through to university. Her greatest challenge is to own a commercial establishment.

loans.use: buy products to resell such as beans and peanuts.

loans.name: Tenghory Diamalaye Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt membres qui exercent le petit commerce. Elles remboursent toujours leurs prêts à temps sans difficultés. Madame Rosa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter des légumes en quantité avec le prêt sollicité. Elle est une femme dynamique et engagée pour le meilleur de son foyer. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This rural bank was inaugurated on 10th July, 2002. This group is made up of twenty members who engage in petty trade. They always reimburse their loans on time with no difficulties.
Mrs Rosa who is raising her hand on the right of the photo is the group representative. She is married, 47 years old and the mother of four children including three girls. She has been selling vegetables for several years. She will purchase a large quantity of vegetables with her requested loan. She is a dynamic woman, committed to bettering her household. The earnings will go towards savings and will help her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maram's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 18 Septembre 2013 et est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et habitant toute le même village et exerçant comme principale activité le petit commerce. 

Madame Maram (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants (01 garçon et 02 filles). Elle  s’active dans le petit commerce et l’agriculture. 

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 02 bouteilles de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 15000f la bouteille 02 sac de 50 kg de sucre à  25000f le sac et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte acheter un terrain ; s’occuper de ses enfants (habillements , soin médicaux etc..)
texts.en:
This group started on the 18th of September, 2013 and is made up of members who have good social cohesion, all live in the same village and primarily engage in petty trade.
Mrs Maram (standing at the extreme right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of three children (one boy and two girls). She works in petty trade and agriculture. With this loan, she intends to buy two 20-litre bottles of refined oil at 15000f per bottle, two 50-kg bags of sugar at 25000f per bag, and other condiments to retail them in her village. With her earnings, she intends to buy a plot of land and take care of her children (clothing, medical care, etc).

loans.use: to buy two 20-litre bottled of refined oil at 15000f per bottle and 2 50-kg bags of sugar at 25000f per bag.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 27-year-old hardworking married man with 2 children aged 2 and 4 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he operates a butcher shop business. He also earns an extra income from his rentals. This has enabled him to get income and care for his family.

He plans to open up another butchery but he is challenged by inadequate capital. This is a second loan Michael is taking having paid the previous one back very well.

He is requesting a loan to buy goats and cows to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 35 years old and single.

Charito runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, biscuits, home product care items, and other groceries.

Charito has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, biscuits, home product care items, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 59 años de edad, es casada su esposo tiene una edad de 58 años, son padres de dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven en el extranjero, su actividad económica principal es la venta de mariscos, además tiene ganado de repasto, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 28 años, trabaja todos los días y lo aprendió de su familia.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar pescado, camaronees y moluscos para seguir trabajando y ofrecer productos frescos, además tiene planeado adquirir una ternera para engordarla y posteriormente tener mejores ingresos, tiene fe que los resultados de la inversión sean positivos.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar su negocio y tener acceso a una vida de mucho más calidad.
texts.en:
Vilma, age, 59, is married, and her husband is 58 years old. They have two grown children who live abroad. Her main business activity is selling seafood. She also has grazing cattle. She has had the business for 28 years. She works every day. She learned this work from her family.

She will use the loan to buy fish, shrimp, and shellfish in order to keep working and to offer fresh products. She also plans to get a calf to fatten and later have better earnings. She has faith that the results of the investment will be positive.

Her aspirations are to improve her business and to have access to a much better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and shellfish in order to keep working and offer fresh products.  She also plans to get a calf to fatten.

loans.name: Tenghory Diamalaye Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt femmes qui exercent le petit commerce. Elles remboursent toujours leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Astou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité des sacs d'oignons, de carottes et de pomme de terre. Femmes très brave, elle a toujours eu des succès dans son activité. les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This rural bank was inaugurated on 10th July, 2002. This group consists of twenty women who engage in petty trade. They always successfully reimburse their loans.
Mrs Astou who is raising her hand at the right of the picture is the group representative. She is married, 50 years old and mother of seven children including four girls. She has been selling vegetables for several years. With this loan, she intends to buy bags of onions, carrots and potatoes. A very brave woman, she has always been successful in her activity. The earnings will go towards savings and to help her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Tenghory Diamalaye Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de sept femmes. Elles s'exercent toutes dans le commerce et elles remboursent toujours leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Diabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47 ans et mère de quinze enfants don dix filles. Elle s'active depuis plusieurs années dans la vente de l'huile de palme et du citron. Elle est une femme très brave et douée dans son domaine d'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et aussi à aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This rural bank was inaugurated on 10th July 2002. This group consists of seven women. They all engage in trade and always reimburse their loans with success.
Mrs Diabou who is raising her hand at the right of the photo is the group representative. She is married, 47 years old and the mother of fifteen children including ten girls. She has been selling palm oil and lemons for several years. She is a very brave woman and very dedicated in her activity. The earnings will go towards savings and also helping her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and lemons.

loans.name: Satyabati

texts.en:
Satyabati, 31, is a widow from a small interior village of Sambalpur district. She lives with her two daughters and enjoys a contented living. She owns a grocery shop where she sells various food items beverages, sanitizers and stationary items.

She is the only breadwinner in her family and works really hard to give a good upbringing to her two daughters and never make them feel the absence of their father. Due to lack of funds and the financial crisis that she was undergoing, Satyabati was never able to build a toilet for her house.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet, install a commode and incorporate water pipes in it. This will help her in improving her safety and hygiene and safeguard her family's health.

loans.use: to build a toilet, install a commode and incorporate water pipes in it.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 23 years old with one child.

Gelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Gelyn has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Gelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en:
Fidelia is married with three children and her husband is a teacher.

Fidelia is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.

Fidelia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as biscuits, water, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk and candles. 

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, water, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk and candles

loans.name: Tenghory Diamalaye Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt membres qui exercent toutes le petit commerce. elles remboursent toujours leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Sano qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. elle est veuve, âgée de 87 ans et mère de neuf enfants dont huit filles. Elle s'active dans la vente d'arachide depuis plusieurs décennies. Elle va acheter avec le prêt solliciter plusieurs sacs d'arachides. Avec son âge avancé elle est toujours dynamique et mène très bien son activité. les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was launched on July 10, 2002. This group consists of 20 members who all practice small trade and who always repay their loans without incident.

Mrs. Sano, age 87, is the group's representative. She is on the right in the group photo, raising her hand. She is a widow with nine children, eight of them girls. She started selling groundnuts decades ago. She plans to use her loan to buy several sacks of groundnuts.

Despite her advanced age, she remains dynamic and manages to run a successful activity. She will use her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of candy for eid season for his stall

loans.name: Dagath Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe créé depuis Août 2009, il réunit des femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'élevage. Maguette l'emprunteur en vedette debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, et levant le bras, est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 34 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03filles et un garçon. Son activité est la restauration du petit déjeûner.Elle s'approvisionne au niveau des grossistes de la commune et parvient à revendre en suite dans son village après la cuisson pour le petit déjeûner. Elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre, 01 sac de pomme de terre, 01 sac d'oignon et des condiments (piment, ail, poivre, cube maggi). Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de constituer un fonds de roulement pour acheter des ovins (mouton ou chèvre).
texts.en:
This group, created since August 2009, brings together women who live in the same village and whose activities are petty trade and rearing of livestock.
Maguette, the featured borrower standing at the extreme right of the photo and raising her arm, is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children of whom three are girls and one is a boy. Her activity is catering breakfasts. She gets her supplies from the community's wholesalers and then manages to sell them for breakfast in her village, after cooking them. She intends to purchase one bag of sugar, one bag of potatoes, one bag of onions and condiments (pepper, garlic, black pepper, maggi cubes). Her goal is to increase her savings and to build working capital so that she can buy sheep or goats.

loans.use: to buy sugar, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Tukolere Wamu Farmers Group-Kazinga

texts.en:
Justine is a new client in Ugafode microfinance ltd. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman owning aretail shop in abid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 500,000/= to buy more items to boost the business. She is however faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

Justine is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and kiva lenders offered to her and other group members since she is now able to fund her business.

The sixth person at the extreme right is the UGAFODE Credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to boost her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and has six children. Maribel is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maribel has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit runs a small shop in the center of Kapan town where she trades different home supplies, clothing and stationery products.

Lilit lives with her two little daughters and her husband who is the main support for Lilit to run a business. The requested loan is very important for her to enable her to purchase a new stock of products for her store. The new academic year will soon start and Lilit wants to be prepared for it.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock to sell in the store (school supplies, clothing).

loans.name: Carla

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2008. Este é o seu 10º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir mercadoria para o seu estabelecimento como: feijão, óleo e arroz para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo um espaço para abrir um parque infantil.
texts.en:
She was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children who go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2008. This is her tenth loan with Hluvuku, and she is planning to use it to buy supplies for her store, such as beans, oil, and rice, in order to fulfill her customers’ needs.

She plans to expand her business in the future: she will buy a place to open a kindergarten.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, and rice to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 35 anos de idade solteira mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2009, este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e chapas para dar conforto a sua família. 
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra, mobilar a mesma e garantir a escolaridade dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
O seu maior desafio é abrir uma mercearia para venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade.
texts.en:
She was born in Maputo and is 35 years old. She is a single mother and has four children, who go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2009. This is her eighth loan with Hluvuku, and she is planning to use it to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement and metal sheets to give her family a comfortable home.

In the future, she is planning to finish building her house, furnish it, and guarantee her children’s higher education. Her biggest challenge is to open a store to sell essential products.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and metal sheets to give her family a comfortable home.

loans.name: Sukaina

texts.en: Sukaina is a 24 years old married lady. She lives in one of the underprivileged areas in Jordan where she and her husband struggle to make a living. She has been selling women’s clothing items suitable for the women in the area and sells them from her home. It helped in having some income but she found out that she needs to add a new collection to what she already sells. For that she is applying for this youth loan to add kids clothing items.

loans.use: to add kids clothing items for sale

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Battambang province, Sokea is 38 years old and is a mother of five children, with four of them in school while another one is too young to attend school. This breadwinner has been growing rice as the main source of the family’s income for years and she is also selling grocery items to supplement her income.

Because she lacks working capital to increase the farming business, now she is applying for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and it will be her eight loan cycle. The past loan enabled her to have enough consumption to support her family and it was fully paid back. Sokea will use her loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to grow a better crop. She hopes she can earn more income, so as keep sending her children to school and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marilyn has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and spices for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and spices for her business

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en: Carlota is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business.She is married and has five children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, sugar, salt, coffee, shampoo, biscuits, eggs, sodas and beer.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. Carlota is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, shampoo, water, biscuits, eggs, Fanta Cocacola, Sagiko, fish and beer.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is so grateful that she has received numerous loans for the past two years and has not failed to pay on time. Those loans certainly helped sustain her peanut spread business and grocery store. Her husband's salary as a carpenter is not enough to meet their living expense, so Gemma does her best to augment their income.

She hopes that she can avail a Php 8000 loan to fill her store with grocery items such as instant noodles, canned goods, rice, eggs, beverages and toiletries. Part of the loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, oil, coconut, sugar to make her peanut butter and coco jam for sale. Although her peanut butter sales is not consistent, she is thankful that her grocery items are fast moving. She is grateful for your continuous support on her livelihood. It will surely help cover their daily sustenance and school needs of her college child.

Gemma prays to maintain and grow her business and dreams for her child to pursue Masteral studies to allow her better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her food production business and grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 55 years old and has one child in school.

Editha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Adelina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, gasoline, fishing net, etc. for her business.

Adelina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, gasoline, fishing net, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ignacia Rebecca

texts.en:
Ignacia Rebecca is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 53 years old.

Ignacia Rebecca has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Ignacia Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono e insecticidas, además pagara mozos para preparar el terreno y así sembrar maíz y ajonjolí, espera seguir teniendo cosechas abundantes y ampliar su mercado.
Con el crédito anterior pudo realizar sus trabajos agrícolas en el tiempo indicado, las cosechas obtenidas no fueron muy abundantes por la falta de lluvia, pero si logro generar los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con sus obligaciones, tiene la fe de construir su casa propia para vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar needs a new loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay workers to prepare the land so that he can plant corn and sesame. He hopes to continue to have abundant harvests and expand his market. 

With the previous loan, he was able to complete his farm work on time. His harvests were not very abundant because of a lack of rain, but he was able to generate the necessary income to fulfill his obligations. His hope is to build his own house for a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay workers to prepare the land so that he can plant corn and sesame

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is a conservative 24 years old married lady, so she asked her husband who supports her to take her place in the photo.
Baraa is a mother of four children and lives in one of the underprivileged areas in Jordan where she and her husband struggle to make a living. She started her own business by bringing some women’s clothing items suitable for the women in the area and sold them from her home and by knocking on neighborhood’s houses to promote the goods and sell. Step by step she managed to open a small store, where she is now selling accessories, clothing items, cosmetics, personal hygiene products.

Baraa is looking to redecorate her store and add more types of accessories, so she applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more accessories.

loans.use: to redecorate her store and add more types of accessories for sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo, solteira, mãe de 1 filho menor de idade que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir bens para sua casa como: computador, televisor e telefone para facilitar os seus estudos.
Futuramente pretende abrir um negócio de criação de frangos e venda de artigos como vestuários.
texts.en:
She was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. She is single and has an underage son, who goes to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and she is planning to use it to purchase household goods such as a computer, a TV set, and a telephone, which will help her with her studies.

In the future, she plans to open a business to raise chickens and sell products such as clothes.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a TV set, and a telephone, which will help her with her studies.

loans.name: Jacider

texts.en:
Jacider is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. She has a green grocery business which she has been running for 10 years now. Besides the grocery, she runs a beauty salon and also does farming.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loan.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to make more profits to educate her children. She will use profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children as well as a water tank and seeds to plant on her farm.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell and hopes this will enable her to make more profits and be able to educate her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, is 29 years old and has three children in school.

Conception has a fishing business in the Philippines. Conception requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business.

Conception has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Conception would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Melanie has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.

Gina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production for her food vending business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, tomatoes, onion, cheese, bacon bits, vegetable oil, sodas, and juices for her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells meat, which is a business he supplements with crop growing for extra income. He says he started the business so as to educate his children and his desire is to own a modern butcher shop with all the necessary equipment for keeping the meat fresh. This will attract more customers and increase his sales. His vision is held back by inadequate capital and high rental fees.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to grow for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows to grow for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Soklay is 40-years-old and a married mother of five kids. The main source of her income is from selling grocery items. On the other hand, she grows sesame and tobacco to get more income. She has been involved in these businesses for around twenty-one years. Due to her grocery business not doing too well and the depreciation of tobacco prices, are the main challenges for her in earning income to support her family.
For Soklay, this is the second loan cycle for her with VisionFund and she has fully repaid her previous loan. She now has a better house to stay in and is able to send her children to school through the past loan.

She is now leading a group of two to take a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on buying more grocery items to attract more customers. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to spend her entire loan portion on buying more grocery items to attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a 47-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Out of these six children, two of them are still attending school and they are ages 16 and 9 years old.

Florentina is a motorcycle owner and her husband is a driver. They have earned a living for 10 years through this business.

Thus she is asking a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle.

Florentina and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their family. In the future, she is planning to start a new business, like raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor has operated her furniture shop business since 1987. She is married and had four children.

Aside from furniture, she also raises pigs to sell. She and her husband work hard to sustain her family's basic needs and improve their business involvement.

Eleanor would like to purchase 1,405 board feet of wood for her furniture shop business, so she is requesting a loan of PHP25,000.

She hopes that she could obtain this amount of loan to obtain greater income and improve the finish furniture products she offers.

loans.use: to purchase 1,405 board feet of wood for her furniture shop business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old Syrian married father of two. Due to the low financial and social situations of his family, he left school at a very early age and started sixteen years ago, working in the construction field specialized in tile paving. He has a long experience in this domain and professional skills that's why he is well-known among his region.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start building his own house in Syria, his country. This loan is very important to him for it will provide his family with a shelter in the future.
Hussein hopes to expand his business more to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start building his own house in his country, Syria.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a bakery business for six years.

He will be using the loan to purchase baking utensils and hopes this will help him expand the business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed in life and open another business.

loans.use: to purchase baking utensils to help him expand the business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda 55 years is married and supports three children. She is a hard working small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from Visionfund Kenya of KES.25,000 to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

Roda plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family living standards .

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 25 years old, and he is single. He grows oranges, maize, beans, and mangoes and has been farming for the last seven years. The business is doing so well.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use the profit from his business to expand his farming activities.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a big farmer and supplier of fruits.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 49 years old.

Elena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business.

Elena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as personal care products, junk foods, and other groceries.

Grace has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as personal care products, junk foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 57 years old and married with five children. Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Celsa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as beers, canned goods, coffee, snack foods, biscuits, cereals, etc.

Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Kristina is 28 years old, and her three children are in school.

Kristina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Kristina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Juna dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, bananas for sale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell processed food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of processed food to sell for her buy-and-sell processed food business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of processed food to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is determined and hardworking on running her current business. However she knows that without sufficient capital, all of the hard work will be of little worth. That’s why she applied for a loan on Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and it was granted. She bought materials for the apartment renovation and stocks of frozen goods.

Arlene wants to thank lenders for donating certain amounts to suffice her previous loan. The business is growing since each month her total earnings is approximately P37, 000. She is blessed for God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT. She’s also looking forward as CCT conducts seminars for entrepreneurs. This year, she is requesting for another loan of P25, 000 to add for the business. She’ll utilize the amount if ever granted to buy paints and other materials for her apartment rental and frozen meat, chicken, pork, hotdogs, sausages and other frozen products.

Arlene believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. she is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy paints and other materials for her apartment rental and frozen goods for her other business.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria works hard to support her family. Demetria is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Demetria requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her business.

Demetria has been in this business for 20 years now.

Demetria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Mary is the group leader, aged 41years. She is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 21 years. The group is called DUFATANYE means “Join together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 10 years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans, bananas and sorghum for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, bananas and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a 28 year old produce dealer living in Kagadi Uganda. With the loan, Rogers wants to buy maize for his produce business and beer for his bar. With the previous loans Rogers was able grow his business and bought land in the trading center with the profits he made. In the future Rogers hopes to start up a wholesale shop and educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy maize for his produce business and beer for his bar.

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Mrs Thắm is 31 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for 8 years. Thắm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover the income from her business is not stable because when some diseases happen to her poultry, she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Bhumisuta

texts.en:
Bhumisuta, 34, is a married lady with two beautiful daughters. Her husband works as a bus driver in the nearby town. She hails from a small village of Sambalpur district.

Life was never easy for Bhumisuta right from the first. She always had access to limited resources due to her financial constraints. But due to her immense patience and perseverance, she never broke up. She runs a bakery shop where she sells biscuits, cookies, buns, pancakes, etc.

Unfortunately, she lacks an appropriate toilet in her house, and the toilet that she has is in a damaged condition and is unsuitable to use. Bhumisuta is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to renovate her old toilet and install a new commode.

She aspires to open a restaurant in the future and gain a higher amount of income so that she can secure her daughters’ future.

loans.use: to renovate her old toilet and install a new commode.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 52 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Jeanette is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jeanette requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jeanette has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jeanette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la Costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ceferino se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Ceferino espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ceferino is 57 years old and lives with his wife and their five children in their own house, made of rustic materials, in the district of Canaris, located in Ferrenafe province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast. Life in this district is tranquil. The residents are dedicated, principally, to agriculture, commerce and cattle raising.

Ceferino is a farmer who specifically cultivates coffee. He can count on six years of experience in this field and comes with very good personal and labor references in the zone. The loan he requests will be used to purchase manure and fertilizers in order to perform adequate maintenance on his coffee crop, plus contracting day laborers during harvest season.

With this effort, Ceferino hopes to offer a better quality of coffee to his customers, which should have a positive impact on his level of income and, in the end, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer in order to adequately maintain his coffee plants, and to contract day laborers during harvest season.

loans.name: Othoniel

texts.es:
Othoniel tiene 48 años de edad,casado, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. una zona rural en la que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Othoniel se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como cuyes, patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace varios años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para estos, lo que le permitirá incrementar el stock de su negocio y tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
