Othoniel is 48 years old.  He is married and has a son.  He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.  It is a rural area where the people work in agriculture, ranching, and trade.

Othoniel has worked for a number of years raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, roosters, hens, and chicks.  He has experience in this business and has very good personal and work references from the area.  His business is located in the rear of his home.  He has asked for a loan to buy a larger quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, and chicks, among others, as well as balanced feed for them.  This will allow him to increase his business’s inventory, and it will have a positive impact on the level of his sales.  In the end, it will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, and chicks, among others, as well as balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Sari-sari store business in the Philippines is rampant. At the comfort of your own home you can have your own store. Filipinos prefer to buy items in a Sari-sari store since most are just located in neighborhoods, Baranggays and barrios without spending fair going to cities just to buy items. Sari-sari is a Filipino word which means “variety” where items are cheaper since products are purchase on wholesale but being sold by piece, kilos or by volume to consumers. Candies, biscuits, seasonings, canned goods and such are being sold by piece. Peanut butter, mayonnaise and other spreads are being sold by volume while rice and animal feeds, meat and chicken are measured by kilos.

Venus is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2005, a housewife and a sari-sari store owner. She enjoys managing the store since she can take care of her family while doing the business. Indeed, this became a medium for their monetary needs. However, not all the time she earns good profit. She still needs capital to buy additional products so that her store will become a one-stop-shop. Venus applied for a P20, 000 as an added capital since she aims to expand the business by adding grocery items, fresh meat and chicken.

On a weekly basis, Venus regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add products to her variety store such as grocery items, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is grateful that she was granted a number of loans for the past four years which she has fully paid on time. Those loans definitely helped sustain and grow her pineapple farm. Her farm of twenty years means a lot to her, for it is where she gets funds to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Life maybe hard at times, but God has been faithful to her family.

She trusts that she will again access a loan, this time for PHP 25,000, which she will use to buy fertilizers for a more productive harvest of her crops and partly to pay for her laborers at her farm. Although there are times that her harvest is low, she maintains her strong faith that God will supply all their needs.

Aurelia dreams for her farm to grow and flourish. She trusts in continued blessings on her family. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old.

Rosita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ricci

texts.en:
Ricci is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ricci is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Ricci has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ricci requested a PHP 140000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ricci has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ricci would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a university student, in his last year, majoring in Banking and Finance. Because his family’s financial situation is not that good, he works after school to cover his college fees and his pocket money.

Mohammad has faced some shortage in the semester fees and he wants to buy some books. So he applied for this educational loan.

loans.use: to cover the rest of his semester fees for a degree in Banking and Finance and to buy books.

loans.name: Jlg-015(A)-Ayyarmalai Group

texts.en:
25-year-old Latha from Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. She spends Rs. 400 every month on medical expenses. Latha's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with 3 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Latha has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

So, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
Nazar is a careful father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. He is living in the district with his family. He is married and has five children. He is a gentle, hardworking and responsible person.

For more than 15 years his work has been to serve agricultural places with a tractor car. He earns enough money to ensure his family's stability.

Nazar's son is studying abroad in Russia. The university where his son studies is asking that he make payment on time.

Nazar appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a loan to pay his son's tuition fee. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Mahmmud

texts.en:
Raed is a 30-year-old, single man from Khanyounis city in the Gaza strip. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Raed started his own business a few years ago, managing a stall for selling clothes.
This is the only source of income for the family. Raed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him buy a new collection of women clothes for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income.
Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women clothes for his stall.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 38 years old and married to a farmer. For the last four years, Margie has been engaged in a Sari-sari (convenience) store business to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 9000 PHP to buy soft drinks, wine, feed, fertilizer, rice, seasoning, condiments and toiletries. Her income will be utilized for a healthy diet, household expenses and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she plans to engage in other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, wine, feed, fertilizer, rice, seasoning, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 50 years old now.

Victoria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Victoria has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Here is Armen, young and enthusiastic taxi driver from Kapan town. He lives with his parents and for 2 years is involved in taxi driving. Armen currently needs some financial support to be able to renovate the car so it will function well and without problems.

Armen asks lender to support him to pay for gas installation on the car, renovation of the engine and new tire.
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for gas installation on the car, renovation of the engine and new tires.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is 62 years old and has six children, one in school. Her husband is a farmer while she sells firewood. Aside from selling firewood, Lolita is also engaged in buying and selling fruit. Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy firewood and fruit to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her standard of living so she has enough money for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fruit.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is 41 years old and has three school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer and works hard for their family. Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, spices, sugar, biscuits, chips, candies, toiletries, soft drinks, drinking liquor, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice. In the future, she plans to buy sacks of rice to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, spices, sugar, biscuits, chips, candies, toiletries, soft drinks, drinking liquor, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida was able to utilize her previous loan to buy a computer set and upgrade and repair old computers. She’s thankful for the monetary support from lenders and kind consideration of the CCT for approving her prior loan.

Adelaida considered the business to be growing, as she’s able to earn PHP 15,000 every month from the computer shop. Her patrons are mostly youths who rent computers to play online games or to complete projects and homework. She also has an apartment for rent on a monthly basis, from which she earns PHP 2,500.

You’ll know if the business is growing if the numbers of customers is increasing. Adelaida needs to add an additional printer and other computer peripherals to accommodate all of the customers that visit the shop. Moreover, she also needs to renovate her apartment. Adelaida applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy necessary materials for the business. She’s hoping that the loan this year will be granted as well by CCT.

On a weekly basis, Adelaida regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed for her business and to buy additional computer units.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-production business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and has five children. Helen is married and has four children who are in school.
Helen is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married with four children, two in school. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose took a loan from TRM for her daughter, because the child still in school at the junior high school and this loan is used to buy books, pencils, shoes, school clothing and school enrollment fees.
And Jose is very excited because this loan is very helpful for Jose to help her reach her goal for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy books, pencils, shoes, school clothing and pay school enrollment fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49 years old married man and a father for four children. He works in a construction tools shop with his brother, and he lives in an apartment above the store. His wife has recently traveled outside the country for work for her Ph.D certificate.

On the other hand, Ahmad was not able to finish his studies when he was young and he did not see that it was too late to continue, so he registered to get a bachelor degree in Politics and is now one of the oldest students in the university.

Ahmad is applying for a loan to help him pay for the university fees.

loans.use: to help him pay for his degree in Politics, as a mature student

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza city, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.

He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Nihad also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Nihad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Nihad can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot! Nihad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has been running her variety store for three months.She is married to a carpenter and they have one child.The couple also grows and harvests bitter gourd as an additional source of income.Teresita would like to keep her variety store profitable and satisfy her customer demand but lacks sufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 36-year-old man from Leyte, Philippines. He is single and has no children. He works hard to help his parents with their daily needs.

To earn a living, he buys and sells dried fish and firewood. He has been doing this business for two years.

Jessie is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more dried fish and firewood to sell.

In the future, he wants to expand his business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and firewood

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Adelaida is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Adelaida has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 63-years-old married woman and has seven children.

Wilfreda is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Wilfreda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags, and other supplies for her business.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilfreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Alma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline and other supplies needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Alma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and other supplies needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 41-year-old married mother of four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nora has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF ito buy more rice to sell.

Nora has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 33-year-old mother of two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a food production business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Midress

texts.en:
Midress is a hard-working woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy building materials (like stones) to finish building her rentals. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income, but she also does crop growing and owns rentals for supplementary income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and take care of her children. Though she faces challenges of a high rate of defaulters and inadequate capital, she hopes to expand her business by building more rentals to increase her income and satisfy her dream.

Midress intends to use the loan to buy cement and hire labor to finish building her boy's quarters property.

loans.use: to buy cement and hire labor to finish building her boy's quarters property.

loans.name: Jacobo Antonio

texts.es:
Jacobo tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de café con ya más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, está casado con Rosa Isabel y tienen 5 hijos bajo su cargo, Jacobo y su esposa trabajan a diario para darles a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan. Su sueño como matrimonio es verlos a todos convertidos en personas de bien. 
Jacobo actualmente está interesado en una práctica que se ha hecho muy popular en la zona y es la producción de café orgánica, esta práctica permite producir café de mayor calidad y por ende vender a mejores precios, hace las fincas más sostenibles, cuida de los suelos y no contamina el medio ambiente.
Jacobo solicita un crédito para iniciar el proceso de certificación orgánico de su cafetal para lo que ha decidido replantar e iniciar el proceso con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido Jacobo tendrá los suficientes ingresos para que a sus hijos no les falte nada. 
Un préstamo ayudara a Jacobo a replantar y a certificar su cafetal lo que le permitirá vender su café a mejores precios, cuidar el medio ambiente y darles sus hijos oportunidades para su futuro.
texts.en:
Jacobo is 42 years old. He works in agriculture, specifically producing coffee with more than 20 years experience in the field. He is married to Rosa Isabel and has five children under his care. Jacobo and his wife work hard to give their children all they need. Their dream as a matrimony is to see all their children grow up to be good people.

Jacobo at present is interested in a practice that has become very popular in the region and that is the production of organic coffee. This technique allows production of a higher quality coffee which in the end is sold at better prices. It makes farms more sustainable, protects the soil and doesn't damage the environment.

Jacobo is requesting a loan to begin the process of organic certification for his coffee plantation. So he has decided to replant and start the process with totally new plants. With the profits obtained from the organic coffee Jacobo will have sufficient income so that his children don't go wanting.

A loan will help Jacobo replant and certify his coffee plantation. This will allow him to sell his coffee at higher prices, care for the environment and provide his children with opportunities for their future..

loans.use: to buy coffee plants of organic origin, organic manure and other necessary expenses to convert his coffee crops to organic.

loans.name: Bernadete

texts.en:
Bernadete is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business.She is married and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sugar, salt, milk, water, noodles and salt.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver and she is happy with this loan, because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, milk, water, noodles and salt.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania is a 24-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she began working as a teacher to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses.

Tania and her husband's salaries are very limited, therefore, it is not enough to cover any additional expenses. Today, Tania is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to paint her house.

Tania hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to paint her house

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 54 years old and married. She has been selling vegetables for about four years now. Her children attend school, and her income goes for their daily expenses for food and allowances.

Amelia wants to continue improving her sales, but has insufficient funds to buy more vegetables. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000. She will buy cabbages, tomatoes and eggplant. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es un joven muy esforzado que se dedica a la siembra de varios cultivos agrícolas, solicita un préstamo de seiscientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 650 000) para la compra de abonos, semillas y demás insumos agrícolas necesarios para el buen crecimiento y desarrollo de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Carlos is a young man who works with great energy in growing a variety of agricultural crops. He is requesting a loan of six hundred fifty thousand colones (650,000 CRC) to buy manure, seeds and other agricultural inputs needed for good growth and development of his crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es un joven que trabaja en su propia lechería, con el fin de aumentar el número de animales en su finca, solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1000 000), para la compra de novillas que le permitirán aumentar su producción de leche y de esta manera aumentar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Esteban is a young man who works on his own milk farm. With the aim of increasing the number of animals on his farm he is requesting a loan of one million colones (1,000,000 CRC) to buy heifers. This will allow him to increase his milk production and in this way increase the sales of his business.

loans.use: to buy heifers for milking.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un caficultor de 40 años casado con Ángela Beatriz, El se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, Luis Fernando lleva ya más de 20 años en la producción de café y 5 años trabajando con sellos de certificación.
Luis Fernando tiene 2 hijos bajo su responsabilidad y el piensa que dejarles un patrimonio no es suficiente, “dejarles un planeta sano es la mejor y más importante herencia”: Menciona, Su más grande sueño es que sus hijos puedan disfrutar de las bondades de la tierra y que por medio de ella tengan las mejores oportunidades y prepararlos para que las sepan aprovechar.  
Actualmente en la región se ha vuelto muy popular producir café bajo prácticas de producción orgánica, estas prácticas mejoran la calidad del café lo que hace posible obtener mejores precios por el producto cosechado además hace las fincas mas sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, es por eso que Luis Fernando quiere convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica y aprovechando que las plagas han deteriorado la plantación el decidió replantar el cafetal y llevar a cabo el proceso de certificación con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas. 
Luis Fernando Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo las labores de certificación y replantación de su cafetal, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café el espera obtener ingresos suficientes para darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad. 
Un crédito ayudara a Luis Fernando a iniciar a cultivar su cafetal bajo prácticas amigables con el ambiente y además le proporcionara ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a coffee grower. He is 40 years old and is married to Ángela Beatriz, He produces coffee under various different certification labels such as: Fairtrade and Rainforest. He sells his coffee through COCAFCAL. Luis Fernando has been producing coffee for over 20 years and has been working with certification labels for 5 years.

Luis Fernando has two dependent children and he believes that leaving them an inheritance is not enough, "leaving them a healthy planet is the best and most important legacy". He says that his greatest dream is that his children will be able to enjoy the goodness of the earth and that through it they will have the best opportunities, and be well prepared to make the most of them.

Producing organic coffee has become very popular right now in his region and such practices improve the quality of coffee. This makes it possible to get a better price for harvested crops as well as making farms more sustainable and environmentally friendly. This is why Luis Fernando has chosen to convert his farm to organic production. As pests have damaged his plantation, he has taken the opportunity to replant and undertake a certification process for his brand new plants.

Luis Fernando is requesting a loan to carry out the required work for gaining certification and to put new coffee plants in his plantation. With the profit from his coffee he hopes to have enough income to give his children a quality education. A loan would help Luis Fernando to start growing his coffee crop in line with environmentally friendly practices and it would also give him extra income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to make his coffee plantation organic such as: organic fertiliser, coffee plants and other organic consumables.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hammocks, vitamins, ointments and more, to better stock his shop, increase sales capacity, and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a 31-year-old man from Leyte, Philippines. He is married and has a two-year-old daughter. His wife is a housekeeper while he is engaged in raising pigs. He has been doing this for six years.

Aside from raising pigs, Ruel also owns a motorcycle known as “habal-habal” in the Visayas Region. Thus, Ruel is asking for a loan to buy feed for his pigs and to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to buy a “multicab” (a kind of custom-made vehicle that can accommodate up to 20 passengers).

loans.use: to buy feed and spare parts

loans.name: Hiloloy

texts.ru: Хилолой простая женщина из города Турсунзаде. Ей 34 года и она замужем. Хилолой мать троих замечательных детей. Её муж является разнорабочим. С детства у Хилолой был большой интерес к портному делу. Она прошла курсы кройки и шитья, и стала вышивать и брать заказы на дому. Она приобрела уверенность в своем деле и стала одной из лучших швеёй в своем городе. Несмотря на то, что все заказы она выполняет на своей старой швейной машинке,  она шьет очень красиво и аккуратно. Но теперь уже её машинка не в состоянии хорошо сшить и поэтому Хилолой обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку с компьютерным моделированием. Она очень полагается на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Hiloloy is a simple woman from the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 34 years old and she is married. Hiloloy is the mother of three wonderful children. Her husband is a laborer. Hiloloy has had a great interest in tailoring since childhood. She has taken courses in cutting and sewing, and started embroidering and taking orders at home. She has gained confidence in her work and become one of the best seamstresses in her town. Despite fulfilling all her orders on her old sewing machine, she sews very beautifully and neatly. But now her sewing machine is not in a condition to sew well and so Hiloloy has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine with computer modelling. She is really relying on your help.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a livestock farmer and also does cash crop farming. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy a cow and animal feed for her livestock which she will later sell at a profit to support her family. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her farming and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a cow and animal feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Susana is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and food vending businesses.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities with her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en: Ronel is drives a motorcycle known as a “habal-habal” in Visayas Region. Habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers in a row. Ronel is 25-year-old man and has two children.  His wife is a housekeeper and takes good care of their children. Ronel works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future, he plans to own a sari-sari store to help him increase their income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a sari-sari store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children ages 14, 10 and four years old. Her husband is a farmer while she runs a sari-sari store business. 

She has been running this business for eight years. Virginia is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, spices, eggs, canned goods, powdered chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, toiletries, laundry soap and candies. She also wants to buy pigs for additional income. In the future, Virginia wants to expand her business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, spices, eggs, canned goods, powdered chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, toiletries, laundry soap and candies.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Richel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Richel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and married with nine children, five of whom are currently in school. 

Marlyn is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marlyn has been in this business for five years, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a scrap business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of scrap to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of scrap to sell

loans.name: Eliflor

texts.en:
Eliflor is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living with a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eliflor is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eliflor has been in pig fattening for six years and earns additional income from manicure/pedicure services.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more makeup products and accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ngama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2009 et réuni des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Coumba qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est le représentante du groupe,elle est veuve,est âgée de 49 ans,et sans enfant.

Son activité est le commerce de savons,de légumes et de bananes.

Le crédit lui permettra d'acheter 01 sac de savon à 25000f le sac,du de gombo et de l' aubergine pour une valeur de 20000f et aussi elle compte investir 25000f pour la réfection de la clôture du périmètre jardinier.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de réfectionner sa case.
texts.en:
This group was formed in 2009. It brings together members who live in the same village and who work in small business. 

Coumba, pictured at right with her hand raised, is the group representative. She is a 49-year old widow who has no children. She sells soap, vegetables, and bananas. 

The loan will allow her to buy a bag of soap for 25,000 F, and okra and eggplant for 20,000 F. She will invest 25,000 F in the repair of her garden’s fence. 

Her goal is to meet the needs of her family and to repair her fence.

loans.use: buy soap, okra, eggplant, seeds, and bananas.

loans.name: America

texts.en:
America is a 45-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. She supports her three children, ages 9, 10 and 15, by selling clothing, operating a sari-sari store and farming rice. 

America is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like shirts, pants, blouses, children's wear and grocery items like detergent, noodles, condiments, seasoning and canned food. With the loan she will have additional capital. She will be able to attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, she dreams of seeing her children become educated and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy  shirts, pants, blouses, children's wear and grocery items like detergent, noodles, condiments, seasoning and canned food.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, I will be able to put up a profitable grocery store and a viable water refilling station. We will finish our dream house and our child will live a better life.”

Leny, 43, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She’s a dedicated member of the cooperative for almost six years where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and the sharing of life experiences. 

Leny is married to Jose, a 53-year-old electrician, and they have a child who is studying. She operates a variety store that sells dry goods and grocery items. Simultaneously, she distributes mineral water in their community. It’s her way of complementing her husband’s income as electrician. 

She is asking for PHP 50,000 in additional capital mainly to buy more gallons of mineral water and partly to procure additional dry goods for her store. She would really appreciate it if you could extend your kind support to her. She prays that more blessings would come your way.   

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of mineral water.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy is 53 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school.

Medy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Medy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Medy would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 46-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old, and married with six children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns income from raising pigs and selling food.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jlg-001-Veerambur Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Maheshwari lives with her husband and two children. She leads a group of three women in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. They have no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Taking matters into their own hands, Maheshwari and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To build toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr:
Codou est âgée de 55ans, elle a adhérer dans le banc villageois depuis le 20 Mars 2007. Elle est la présidente de ce banc villageois. Elle est mariée et ses enfants sont tous majeure.

Elle fait le petit commerce de fruit.Elle va acheter des fruits à Guéoul pour les revendre dans son village. Elle fait cette activité depuis 3ans.Elle vend dans les villages environnantes.

Avec son prêt,elle va acheter 4 casiers de pommes, 4 casiers de bananes et 4 casiers de mandarines. Elle est la seule à faire cette activité.

Avec les bénéfices,elle compte renforcer son épargne et acheter des moutons pour les élever.
texts.en:
Codou is 55 years old and joined the banc villageois on March 20, 2007. She is the president of the banc villageois. She is married and her children are all adults.

She sells fruits. She will buy fruits in Guéoul that she will then resell in her village and neighboring villages. She has been doing this for three years. 

With her loan, she will buy four cases of apples, four cases of bananas, and four cases of mandarin oranges. She is the only one who runs this type of business. 

With her income, she will bolster her savings and buy sheep to raise.

loans.use: buy fruits.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Merly has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is a 57-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosel has a banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Rosel has been in this business for 20 years. Rosel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sorghum, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is from Kapan, where he lives with his parents. A year ago, Edvard started his own business of car washing in his local town. 

Edvard works hard to satisfy his clients' needs and the number of customers increases month by month.  He has applied for this loan to purchase car cleaning equipment.
 
Edvard has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

He hopes to receive your support and develop his business further.

loans.use: to pay for car cleaning equipment for a carwash business.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a typical Pakistani female villager as she has been working from a very tender age. 

She is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother of eight children--one of her children is shown in the photo with her. 

From an early age Manzooran has been involved in the cattle business and looking after livestock. Due to her low purchasing power she has requested a loan of 45,000 to buy new cattle and expand her earnings which will lead to a better standard of life. Currently, she hardly manages to provide two meals on a daily basis in addition to fulfilling their basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy new cattle.

loans.name: Gina Miluska

texts.es: Gina tiene 44 años de edad y esta soltera, actualmente está laborando en transporte público, lo cual le ayuda a obtener ingresos y poder seguir estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho en una Universidad Privada en donde ya va por el VII ciclo de la carrera que decidió estudiar. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una computadora que necesita para poder realizar sus trabajos de la universidad. Como plan a futuro Gina tiene pensado implementar su propio consultorio jurídico donde pueda atender las diferentes demandas de sus clientes. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que está recibiendo y desea que eso continúe con muchas personas que lo necesitan para poder cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and single. She currently works in public transportation, which helps her to earn income and continue her studies in a professional law degree program at a private university. She is now in the 7th semester of her chosen program of study. 

She will use the loan to buy a computer, which she needs in order to complete her university assignments. In the future, Gina plans to open her own law office where she can assist her clients with their various needs. She feels very happy and grateful for the support she is receiving, and she hopes that it will continue for many people who need it in order to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cough medicines, tablets, etc.

loans.name: Eraly

texts.en:
Pottery is like shaping a person’s life. One has to undergo breaking, forming again, shaping, spinning, heating and removing unnecessary fluids that lead to permanent changes like hardening and strengthening of a beautiful outcome, a pot or a vessel. A person’s experiences and trials will also result in his/her intensified vigor if handled properly. After all those hardships, a person can be a beautiful channel of blessings to others. 

It is interesting that Eraly, 46, chose to venture into the pottery business. She has deeply appreciated the processes that happened before she can touch these products. She can compare it to her changed life. Now, she has the capacity to help others by employing them in her pottery shop located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She has two workers who create earthenware products. There are various shapes of pots, jars, vases, and vessels which are attractive to both local and visiting buyers. 

Eraly’s business partner is her husband, Alex, and their inspiration are their five children. They work diligently to provide for their needs and education. 

Now she desires to have a loan assistance of PhP 40,000 to buy a volume of raw materials such as clay, wood, and various patterns for her pottery. She will also use part of the loan to pay her workers. Payment for volume pottery orders from her shop comes late at times, and she needs to adjust so her workers’ salary won’t be affected.

Eraly is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of raw materials such as clay, wood, and various patterns for her pottery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a taxi to work as a taxi driver and improve her level of income for her family.

loans.name: Cleisman

texts.es: El señor Cleisman de 24 años de edad, trabaja actualmente terreno de su padres, no tiene hijos que depende de el ni esposa, vive en domicilio alquilado, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Monteagudo. Su principal actividad es la producción de miel de abejas. Es por eso que requiere un préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de materiales y equipamiento para la apicultura ya que en la zona tiene un buen rendimiento la producción de miel de abeja, con la compra de la misma el señor Cleisman empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de miel por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir ya que esta actividad requiere de menor inversión y menos trabajo en mano de obra una vez establecida la actividad.
texts.en:
Mr. Cleisman is 24 years old, he currently works on his parent's land and does not have any children depending on his wife and him. He lives in a rented space, in the Chuquisaca department of the Monteagudo municipality.
His main trade is the production of bee honey. This is why he requires a loan, destined for the purchase of beekeeping materials and equipment as the area has a good yield on bee honey. With the purchase of the aforementioned, Mr. Cleisman will begin his own harvest and ease his workload through the production of honey. This work will grant him good income and improve his life conditions at home and his daily life because this activity requires less investment and less labor once the harvest is established.

loans.use: purchase beekeeping materials and equipment allowing him to have better products for sale and improve his quality of life

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom who is currently in school. 

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for five years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF.

Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sarah Jane has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Sarah Jane requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sarah Jane has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Sarah Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Irish has a general store business in the Philippines. Irish requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Irish has been in this business for three years. In the future, Irish would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sreypech

texts.en:
Srey Pech is a 25-year-old mother of two young children living in Kratie province. To earn income for her family, she sells grocery items and works for others for a fee as her additional income source. 

She has been involved in her current business for seven years. This is Srey Pech's first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a new loan with VisionFund in order to purchase more grocery items for resale. She hopes that this loan can improve her business with a good income to support her living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has the responsibility of looking after four children, aged 4, 6, 8 and 10 years. He deals in goat meat, and also grows crops which helps with extra income. He uses his profits to support his family by providing them with food, education and other basic needs. His main challenge is the price fluctuation of goats, though he hopes to expand his business to new market areas. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more goats for slaughtering and sale.

loans.use: to buy more goats for slaughtering and sale.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 27-year-old single lady who started working as a hairdresser from her house five years ago to cover her expenses. She is an independent lady who is responsible for four members of her family. 

Maysaa is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Maysaa hopes to expand her business more in the future by opening her own beauty salon to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics.

loans.name: Khaleel

texts.en:
Raed is a 26-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city in the Gaza strip. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Raed started his own business. He manages a stall selling sweets like kunafa and sahlab.

This is the only source of income for the family. Raed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new sweets for the eid seasons for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new sweets for eid season for his stall.

loans.name: Las Rosalinas Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LAS ROSALINAS,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay,provincia de de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Mateo continua dedicándose  a la agricultura como cultivos de papa entre otros, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  este negocio  el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, él socio a la vez continua siendo artesano, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios son artesanos.
texts.en:
Mateo is one of the members of Las Rosalinas Group. This communal bank is located in the district of Lamay, in Calca province, department of Cusco.

Member Mateo still works as a farmer growing potatoes and other crops. He is a responsible and diligent person. He has been in this business for a good amount of time and it brings him a personal sense of fulfillment. He also still works making crafts. This is how he provides for his family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other products.

All of the members of this group are grateful for the loans they receive and promise to comply with their set payment terms.

The rest of the members all work making crafts.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other products.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, a 40-year-old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner, married to Judy, a 39-year-old carpenter. They reside in Tigbauan, Iloilo together with their two children. They survived the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Jonalyn’s variety store business was affected by the typhoon but with the help of her family, they were able to rebuild it.

Jonalyn’s income from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has a wide variety of items and merchandise. She hopes to expand her business by adding to the selection of supplies to meet her customers' demands. She plans to buy more groceries, canned goods, drinks and sacks of rice. She humbly seeks your help through a PhP 30,000 loan. With this, she will be able to boost her income to cover their everyday expenses. It will also contribute to paying the monthly installment for their motorcycle. In due time, she wants to convert her small sari-sari into a grocery store and save enough for their house renovation.

She prays for good health, a complete college education for her children, and peaceful relationships among her family members. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, canned goods, drinks and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Armed with her dream of living happily in her own house someday, Nilda is working hard to improve her business of selling street food combined with a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells Filipinos' favorite street foods, such pork barbecue, pork and chicken intestines, chicken feet, fish balls, and squid balls. Her store also sells bread, chips and beverages. Her profit adds up to her husband’s income as a tricycle driver and provides for their everyday needs and college expenses of their child. They live in Tigbauan, Ioilo in the Visayas region of the Philippines.

However, Nilda knows that the income derived from her business varies from time to time. It is also affected by long-term debts of her neighbors that sometimes deplete her capital. This is the reason that she hopes to obtain additional capital of PHP 20,000. She will also buy grocery items and beverages for her variety store. Furthermore, a portion of the loan will be utilized to renew the franchise of their tricycle. Your financial assistance will surely go a long way.

Nilda draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her street food business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Jorge espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old. He lives with his partner and children in a house they own built with rustic materials. They live in the Cañaris district, located in the Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is calm. Locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. Jorge works in agriculture, growing coffee, to be more specific. He has an 8-year experience and very good personal and professional references.

He will use this loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers to perform the appropriate maintenance on his coffee plantations, and to pay for labor for the harvesting season. With this, Jorge hopes to offer his costumers coffee of better quality, which will have a positive impact on his profits, and therefore on his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. Sally is married and has had a bakery business in the Philippines for three years.

Sally requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, etc..

In the future, Sally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, etc..

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 51 years old, and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elena has a general store business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine operates a transportation business. She had a motorcycle and van for hire. 

Josephine is married with four children. She and her husband would like to have a stable source of income to sustain their family's basic needs. Josephine would like to borrow a loan of PHP10,000 to buy a new battery for her van. She hopes that she can obtain her requested loan amount to improve her living condition and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: To buy a battery for her rental van business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials for cold cuts and sausages to diversify her business and have better living conditions.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with two children who are both in school. 

Delia has been in the pig fattening business for three years in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Delia has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham used the previous loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business. He deals in motorcycle transport. He started these businesses with hope of earning an income. 

Abraham, who is in his fifth loan cycle, has managed to buy motorcycles, pay back his loans and is now planning to buy land. He appreciates the support from Kiva that has enabled him reach this far. 

He is faced with the challenges of people stealing motorcycles and frequent road accidents. Besides that, he has hopes of constructing a permanent house and buying land for agriculture. Abraham requests a loan to buy land where he can construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy land where he can construct a house for his family.

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
Sean, who lives in Mondulkiri province, is a 45-year-old mother of four dependent children. 

She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing cassava and working as a labor worker for others to get additional income. She has been involved in cassava farming for three years. Her cassava does not grow well because it has been destroyed by insects. 

Due to a lack of working capital, she is now leading a group of four members to get a new loan via VisionFund. This is the third cycle for her and she fully repaid her past loans. With her previous loans, she earned a decent income to improve her living situation. As the group leader of this new loan, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy organic pesticides to protect her farm from insects. She hopes that her cassava can produce high yields, so she can earn more income to upgrade her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to protect her farm.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 48-year-old married woman. She deals in selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to cover more of her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her gall bladder operation, in order to improve her health so that she can continue to help her mother with household expenses.

loans.name: Jesus De Nazaret Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal JESUS DE NAZARET, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Juana tiene 43 años de edad tiene 5 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de comida y venta de cerveza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de  esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Jesus de Nazaret" communal bank which is located in the province of Cusco.

Juana is 43 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has five children. She combines her daily activities with working selling food and beer. She has been in this business for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She wants to continue working and in this way continue to support her family.

Juana is requesting the loan to buy rice and oil amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful for the loan and promise to comply with the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy machines, fabric, and thread to expand her manufacture of sportswear and other apparel and to diversify her products, by which she will be able to generate more income.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian lives in Puebla where he works as a farmer. He has been saving and woking for years to build his dream house. He started big, integrating design and thinking about all the great times. But soon he realized he had neither the knowledge nor the money to complete it. The construction was put on hold. However, the dream was always there. Julian is now excited about this opportunity of accessing credit so he can finish his home. He is asking for credit so he can build the roof and work from there. With a roof in place, they will be able to move in. Julian has no access to credit given the informality of his job and his low income. He looks forward to repaying this loan so he can ask for more in the future. With this loan, Julian will receive supervision from certified technicians who will make sure that the construction meets quality and safety standards.

loans.use: to finish a lifelong dream of his own home and give his family a better life

loans.name: Julio Emiro

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 46 años de edad, práctico y recursivo que ante la falta de empleo, encontró en el emprendimiento una manera viable de generar ingresos y calidad de vida a su familia, que es conformada por su pareja y sus dos hermosas princesas que ama con toda el alma.

Su actividad está en vía de progreso, quiere ampliarse y tener mayor cantidad de animales para acordar buenos negocios, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento y vacunas, ya que le gusta entregar sus cerdos en óptimas condiciones.

Este préstamo será el pilar de crecimiento del negocio de Julio que tiene como deseo brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Julio, 46, is a practical, resourceful man. Faced with unemployment, he started a small business of his own to generate income and a quality of life for his family. He has a life partner and two daughters, his two beautiful princesses that he loves with all his heart.

His business is progressing, and he would like to expand by keeping more animals so that he can negotiate better terms. He is applying for this loan to buy pigs as well as feed and vaccines, as he likes to deliver the pigs in optimal condition.

This loan will be the pillar in the growth of his business. Julio's wish is to provide a decent life for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.es: Dulce tiene 51 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en Hermosillo, Sonora. Dulce estudió contaduría pública y trabajo durante 25 años en ese ramo sin embargo por un accidente que sufrió tuvo que dejar de trabajar y buscar otra manera de contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, una amiga le dio la idea de que trabajara desde casa vendiendo perfumes y así lo hizo, actualmente Dulce ya lleva dos años en este negocio, ella quiere consolidar su negocio y hacerlo crecer lo suficiente para que pueda ser la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia. A ella le motiva mucho el pensar que está haciendo algo propio y que en un futuro puede dejar un negocio establecido a sus hijos. Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 Dulce podrá comprar los modelos más recientes de perfumes y volverse más atractiva para sus clientes. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que van a apoyar su causa y le ayudaran a consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dulce is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Hermosillo, Sonora. Dulce studied Public Accounting and worked for 25 years in this field. However, due to an accident, she had to quit and look for another way of contributing to the home expenses. A friend of her gave her the idea of working from home, selling perfumes, which she did. Dulce has been doing this for two years and wants to strengthen her business and expand it in order to make it the family’s main source of income.

Thinking that she has her own business, something she can leave for her children to take over in the future, encourages her to move forward.

With a loan of MXN 10,000, Dulce will be able to buy the latest perfumes and will become more attractive to her customers. She is very thankful to all the people who will support her cause and help her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy the latest perfumes.

loans.name: Lorangie

texts.es:
Lorangie es una joven estudiante de Ingenieria Industrial, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Lorangie, tengo 18 años y vivo en Santo Domingo, República Dominicana, lugar donde nací y crecí. No tengo hijos y soy soltera.  Vivo con mi madre y dos hermanas pequeñas (8 y 12 años), mi madre actualmente no tiene trabajo y nos mantenemos con la pensión que ella recibe mensualmente del padre de mis hermanas, ya que con el mío no tenemos contacto.
Empecé a estudiar ingeniería industrial en la Universidad Tecnológica de Santo Domingo (INTEC), en la cual alcancé a cursar 3 trimestres y luego tuve que retirarme por motivos económicos. En mi tiempo de permanencia en la universidad las materias que más me gustaron fueron introducción a la ingeniería y calculo integral, porque ambas son materias de las cuales voy a depender mucho cuando llegue a ser profesional, además de que aprendí muchas cosas nuevas. Quisiera finalizar mis estudios en esta misma universidad porque sé que es una de las mejores del país y que me ofrece los recursos necesarios para poder desempeñarme y estar bien preparada para el futuro.
El préstamo para mi es totalmente esencial para terminar mi carrera y cumplir mis sueños, porque de no recibirlo tendría que irme definitivamente de la universidad. Si obtengo el préstamo mi vida cambiaria de manera radical, puesto que aparte de tener una mayor motivación para ser una persona excelente en el futuro, sé que me abrirá muchas puertas cuando finalice la carrera. Además de que podre de igual manera animar a jóvenes de escasos recursos igual que yo a estudiar sin importar su estatus económico, pues gracias al crédito eso ya no sería más una barrera.
Luego de graduarme de esta carrera, tengo planeado realizar un post grado y luego otra carrera, y luego de esto seguir estudiando de manera continua. Mi meta máxima en la vida es mantenerme estudiando, para así poder asegurarle a mi familia una vida digna y sin preocupaciones, y también para estar lo suficientemente preparada para poder conseguir un trabajo bueno y estable. El trabajo que deseo tener seria uno en el que pueda ejercer mi carrera, como por ejemplo encargarme de optimizar los procesos de producción de una empresa o industria, o asegurarme del control de calidad de los productos que se consumen diariamente en los hogares.
texts.en:
Lorangie is a young student of industrial engineering. She is applying for a loan to cover educational expenses. This is her story:

“My name is Lorangie. I am 18 years old and live in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, where I was born and raised. I have no children and I am single. I live with my mother and two little sisters (8 and 12 years old). My mother has no job and now we live on the alimony she receives monthly from the father of my sisters; we have no contact with my father.

“I started studying mechanical engineering at the technical university of Santo Domingo (INTEC), where I completed three quarters of the course and then had to withdraw for financial reasons. During my time at university, the subjects that I liked were: introduction to engineering and integral calculus, because I will depend a lot on both when I become a professional; plus I learned many new things. I would like to finish my studies at the same university because I know that it is one of the best in the country and it offers me the necessary resources to perform and be well prepared for the future.

“This loan is absolutely essential for me to finish my degree and achieve my dreams. Without it, I will have to leave university. If I receive the loan my life would change dramatically, because aside from having a greater motivation to be a great person in the future, I know that many doors will be open to me when I finish my degree. In addition, I will likewise encourage underprivileged young people like me to study regardless of their economic status, because thanks to loans that would no longer be a barrier.

After graduating from this degree, I plan to do post-graduate studies and then another degree. Then I will continue to study continuously. My ultimate goal in life is to keep studying, in order to guarantee a decent and carefree life for my family, and also to be sufficiently prepared to get a good, steady job. I would like to have a job where I can practise my profession, such optimizing the production processes of a company or industry, or ensuring quality control of products used daily in homes.”

loans.use: to pay further education costs.

loans.name: Saidgufron

texts.ru: Саидгуфрон молодой человек из не большого городка Истарафшан. Ему всего 19 лет. Он после окончания средней школы пошел работать. Его семья имеет трудное финансовое положение, и он как сын-мужчина должен обеспечить своих родителей и братьев сестер. Саидгуфрон имеет помещение, где изготавливает деревянные окна и двери. Саидгуфрон хорошо научился своей работе и хочет купить хороший станок (для распиливания дерево).
