She started the business to have something of her own and increase her income, and to be in control of her time and be with her child. With this business she wants to cover her expenses, have a better income and expand her business into franchises and have stability and economic freedom. 

Her main difficulties in the business are the seasons, because sometimes she sells very well, and other times it does not go well for her. She needs to stay on the cutting edge with her merchandise. With a loan from MXN 10,000 she will be able to completely renew her merchandise and have new points of sale. 

Claudia is an enterprising woman because she has vision and very high expectations. She fights to achieve her goals and dreams, and she is always analyzing the possibilities for a profitable business. She is very tenacious. 

She is very grateful to the people who have offered her help to keep growing in her business and to cover her expenses as well as better potential for income and marketing.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise and open new points of sale.

loans.name: Safdar

texts.en: Safdar is one of the average Pakistani female villagers as she has been working from a very tender age. She is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. From an early age she has been involved in the cattle business and looking after livestock. Due to her low purchasing power she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR so that she can buy new cattle and expand her earnings, which will lead to a better standard of life. She aspires to save income for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy new cattle and expand her earnings, which will lead to a better standard of life.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is a 44-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 29-year-old married woman from a small village near Jinan City. She lives with her family in a simple house. Two years ago, Huda started her own business. She manages a falafel restaurant that makes sandwiches and sells softdrinks. This is the only source of income for her family.

Huda took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) tol help her to buy a new machine for making falafel for her restaurant. This will increase her sales and also her income.

Huda appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy a new machine to make falafel for her restaurant.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has a daughter. Tatyana owns a small business.

Tatyana has been selling women's and men's shoes at the market for 15 years. She owns one sales spot. Tatyana is a friendly and hardworking person. She is always polite with the clients. Tatyana wants to develop her business further.

Tatyana is asking for a loan of 50 000 UAH to arrange the assortment of men's and women's shoes for the autumn season. The loan will help her to get new clients, increase her income, and take better care of her family.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. Delia relies on farming rice for a living. She also raises hogs for additional income.

Delia is asking for a loan to continue her farming and afford the needed farm inputs to keep her business going. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, feed and the needed amount to pay for hired help labor.

In the future, she hope to improve the life of her family and have other businesses as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and pay for labor

loans.name: Bernedeta

texts.en: Bernedeta is 67 years old. She is married and has one child. She does farming and keeps livestock and has been in this business for 17 years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She will use the generated profits from the expanded business to expand her farming and cater for home expenses. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her farming methods, make more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing agriculture work for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Mumtaz has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which would ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 54 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Sherlita works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherlita has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, rice, soft drinks and other groceries.

In the future Sherlita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charina is 41 years old and three of her children are in school.

Charina has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoos, soap, and rice for her general store.

Charina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Charina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elma requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So, she started a business selling cloth in her community. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and support their education.

Razia is famous among her neighbors for her collections, and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 30 years old, a married woman and mother of 2 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operationing her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Soniya

texts.en:
Soniya is a 22 year old, married woman and a mother of 2 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 54-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Mohammad started his own business a few years ago. He manages a store selling fruits and vegetables. This is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new goods for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new goods for his store.

loans.name: José Lucas

texts.es:
José Lucas es un caficultor de 40 años casado con Carmen, Él se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, el lleva 20 años en la producción de café y 5 años trabajando con sellos de certificación.
José Lucas  tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo y el piensa que dejarles un patrimonio no es suficiente, “dejarles una educación y una cultura de respeto por la vida en general es la mejor herencia”: Menciona, Su más grande sueño es que sus hijos puedan aprovechar de manera oportuna cada oportunidad que se les presente.  
Actualmente en la región se ha vuelto muy popular producir café bajo prácticas de producción orgánica, estas prácticas mejoran la calidad del café lo que hace posible obtener mejores precios por el producto cosechado, además hace las fincas más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, es por eso que José Lucas quiere convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica y aprovechando que las plagas han deteriorado la plantación el decidió replantar el cafetal y llevar a cabo el proceso de certificación con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas. 
José Lucas Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo las labores de certificación y replantación de su cafetal, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café el espera obtener ingresos suficientes para darles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna, darles una buena educación e iniciar la creación de un pequeño patrimonio familiar.
Un crédito ayudara José Lucas a iniciar a cultivar y producir café bajo prácticas amigables con el ambiente y además le proporcionara ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Lucas is a 40-year-old coffee farmer who is married to Carmen. He works in the production of coffee under various certifications, such as Comercio Justo (Fairtrade) and the Rainforest Alliance certification. He will sell his products through COCAFCAL. He has been in this business for 20 years, and has worked with the certifications for 5 years.

José Lucas has 3 children under his care and believes that leaving them a patrimony is not enough. "Giving them an education and a respectful attitude towards life in general is the best inheritance", he says. His biggest dream is for his children to make the most out of every opportunity that comes their way.

It has become very popular recently in the region to produce coffee with organic practices. These serve to improve the quality of the coffee, which makes it possible to get better prices for the harvested product. In addition, it makes the farms more sustainable and environmentally-friendly. It is for these reasons that José Lucas wants to make his farms organic. Taking advantage of the fact that pests deteriorated his plantation, he decide to replant his coffee crops and
begin the process of certification with completely new crops.

José Lucas requests a loan so that he may follow through with the certification process and the replanting of his crops. With the earnings he will obtain off his coffee he hopes to be able to give his children a quality education and begin with the creation of a small family patrimony.

The loan will help José Lucas begin producing coffee under environmentally-friendly practices and will give him enough extra income so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic supplies, organic coffee plants, and organic fertilizers which he needs to make his coffee plantation entirely organic.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 59 años de edad,casada, vive en el Sector Chcarrilla del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Hilda se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, comercio de leche fresca y elaboración artersanal de queso fresco, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y en ocasiones a trabajar una mototaxi que dan a alquiler entre semana, cuentan con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de un becerro asi como alimentos balanceados para mayor producción de leche y de esta manera tener una mayor producción de leche.
texts.en:
Hilda is 59 years old, she's married, and lives in the Chacarrilla Sector of the Cayaltí District, a community that focuses on agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Hilda works in the raising of bovine cattle, in the selling of fresh milk, and the making of fresh artisanal cheese. Her husband works in agriculture, and occasionally works as a motorcycle taxi driver which he can rent on weekdays. They have very good personal, professional, and credit references.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the purchase of a calf, as well as balanced feed for her cattle so that they produce a greater amount of milk.

loans.use: to purchase a calf, as well as balanced feed for the fattening of her cattle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a male aged 38 years and married with four children, all attending school. He deals in farming, and is currently servicing another loan that he is paying well.

He started his business so as to cater for his children. The business is faced with challenges of market competition and price fluctuations of agriculture products. He describes himself as being honest.

He is requesting a loan so as to pay school fees for his children, as he has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Raies

texts.en:
Raies is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children.

Raies has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband worked alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.

At this time, Raies is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time.

Raies hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Five Star Group

texts.en:
Geetaleima is a young entrepreneur who runs a weaving business in Thoubal district in Manipur. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a cultivator. The combined income from her business and her husband's job is not enough to maintain their family expenses.

Geetaleima leads a group of five women. These women, just like Geetaleima, are also engaged in income generating activities. But the present scale of business is not enough to maintain their household expenses and hence they decided to form a group and apply for a loan of INR 50,000. With the loan, Geetaleima plans to sell zero muka phanek, one-ply phanek, two-ply phanek, (all sarongs) etc. The loan will help in expanding the group’s respective businesses. They will be able to put adequate stock of their weaving items such as yarn, loin loom, etc. to sell.

loans.use: to expand her weaving business and sell zero muka phanek, one-ply phanek, (sarongs) etc.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin city, an ancient city located in the West Bank. She manages and operates a small restaurant, where she sells light sandwiches and soft drinks for day laborers and children after school. The community enjoys her sandwiches and it is a very good business, which provides the family with a good income.

Because she wanted to buy some supplies for her restaurant, Sabha took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, she can buy a refrigerator and other supplies to improve her restaurant. Sabha wants to improve her business by making fresh fruit cocktails and so she needs to store perishable items in the refrigerator. Sabha appears in the photo while she was working

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and other supplies to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children ages five, seven and eleven.

For many years now, she has been engaged in farming rice and selling of snacks like mango and home cooked meals. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy mangoes, meat, spices, cooking oil and fertilizer, and to pay for the labor of the hired help. Her loan will help to boost her business and income for her family.

Mary Grace dreams of seeing her children have a good future through education.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, meat, spices, cooking oil and fertilizer, and to pay for the labor of the hired help.

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en: Meresi is a 32-year-old female married with five children, living in Kasese Uganda. She operates a retail shop of general merchandise and gets additional income from making craft baskets used as shopping bags. Meresi is working hard to ensure that she takes good care of her family with the dream of educating her children and building them a good house. Meresi is requesting a loan facility to buy sugar, Blue Band products, rice, beans and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, Blue Band products, rice, beans and others to sell.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is a 43-year-old woman with one child from Pursat province. To improve her family’s living, she has grown rice as her single main source of income for 25 years. For Phorn, this is her second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wisely paid back her past loan which enabled her to earn more income to upgrade her family with decent household supplies. She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan.

As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland to produce a good yield. She hopes this loan can help her rice farm to get a higher yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland to produce a good yield.

loans.name: Segadores Group

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro tiene 68 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos independientes. Es el presidente de la alcancía comunal “Segadores” integrada por 6 personas muy responsables que decidieron trabajar de manera conjunta para cumplir sus objetivos. Pedro tiene como fuente de trabajo un pequeño taller hace algunos años de transformación de café para la venta. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los insumos y utensilios que necesita para poder trabajar y realizar el café. Tiene pensado implementar otro taller donde pueda fabricar muebles en melamina y así brindar trabajo a sus vecinos que tanto lo necesitan. En la foto grupal Pedro se encuentra sentado en medio de sus compañeras paradas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 68 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are now independent. He is the president of the "Harvesters" communal bank, which is composed of six very responsible persons who decided to work together to achieve their objectives. As his source of work, Pedro has had a small workshop for some years that processes coffee for sale.

The loan will be used for purchasing the inputs and utensils needed to be able to work on and complete the coffee processing. Pedro is thinking of opening another workshop where he can make melamine furniture and, thus offer work to their neighbors who most need it.

In the group photo Pedro may be seen seated in the middle with his companions surrounding him.

loans.use: purchase inputs and utensils required to process coffee.

loans.name: Adith Manuel

texts.es:
Adith es una mujer con 22 años de edad, madre de un pequeño con 3 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida vendiendo café desde su casa, un medio el cual le permite estar al pendiente de su hijo y generar los ingresos mínimos para su sostenimiento.
Su deseo es abrir su primer negocio y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.
 
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirte en la compra de termos para café y surtido como parva y snack.

Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de su hijo, pues este es el motor que impulsa a esta mujer para seguir luchando.
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Adith is a 22 year-old woman. She is the mother of a 3 year-old youngster. She earns her living selling coffee from her home, which allows her to be available for her son and earn the basic income to support him.

She hopes to open her first business and be able to provide employment to people who need it.

Currently she is seeking a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of thermoses for coffee and other supplies like parva [small baked goods and sweets] and snacks.

Her dream is to be able to pay for her child’s education, because he is what keeps her going on with her struggle.

You can be a part of this dream! Get inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of thermoses for coffee and supplies such as parva [small baked goods and sweets] and snacks.

loans.name: Sindhusuta

texts.en:
Sindhusta, 50, is a humble and respectful person in her community where she works in agriculture. With this, she is able to get her family ahead and she is able to cover educational expenses for her children, just like a mother would want the best for her family. She hails from a small village in the Sambalpur district. Her husband runs a betel shop in the same village. Sindhusta does not have a toilet in her house and faces a lot of difficulty with the same.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet for her family. This will enable her to promote cleanliness and hygiene in her family and thereby safeguard their health. Sindhusta wants to build her dream house where she can happily spend her life with her family.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita lives in Talibon, Bohol. For eleven years, she has been engaged in buying and selling dried fish and native chicken in her business.

This is her main livelihood. She usually spends time repacking dried fish to sell. She earns an income of PHP 5,000 per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy more native chicken and dried fish. Agapita is 52 years old, but she will continue to work hard so that she can have a hog raising business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more native chicken and dried fish

loans.name: Mukhtair

texts.en:
Mukhtair is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began a business selling milk. Mukhtair is known in her town for providing good quality milk and she owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income she has generated. 

Mukhtair is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan to purchase another buffalo. She will use her loan to improve her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer con 35 años de edad, separa y madre de dos hijos con 8 y 15 años de edad.
Debido a que no cuenta con el apoyo de su ex pareja para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, ella se dedicó a preparar comidas y venderlas desde su propia casa.

De allí se generan los ingresos mínimos para ella cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas e insumos como harina aceite y otros.
Con esto espera ser más ágil en su labor y aumentar sus ventas diarias.

Su meta es continuar trabajando, comprar una vivienda propia y poder pagarle la educación a sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

Con su aporte esta mujer podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
35-year old Ángela is separated from her husband and has two children aged 8 and 15.

As she can no longer rely on support from her ex-husband, she earns her living preparing and selling meals from her house. She earns just enough to cover the necessities for her household.

Now Ángela is seeking a loan to buy a food cart and ingredients such as flour, oil etc. With these purchases she hopes to be more flexible in her work and increase sales.

Her goal is to continuing working, buy a house of her own, and be able to pay for her children's education as their welbeing is a big concern for her.

With your support Ángela will be able to fulfill her dreams, so please, help her by making a loan.

loans.use: Buy a food cart and ingredients like flour, oil etc.

loans.name: Dibor's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
DIOBOR debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont 3 filles et 3 garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire de l'embouche. Elle va acheter deux moutons. Elle achète l'un à 50 000 FCFA et le revend à 100 000 FCFA après élevage.
Les bénéfices serviront à  acheter d'autres moutons pour développer son activité.
texts.en: This group of 37 members is part of a village bank which was created on December 30th 2009.  It is made up of women who live in the same village and surrounding area.  The members have a good relationship with each other and support each other.  Their principal activities are commerce and raising animals.  Diobor, who is at the right of the photo raising her hand, is 52 years old.   She is married and the mother of six children, 3 girls and 3 boys.  After receiving the loan, she hopes to raise animals; she will buy two sheep.  She will buy each one for 50,000 FCFA and resell them for 100,000 FCFA each after raising them.  The earnings will be used to buy other sheep to develop her activity.

loans.use: to buy some sheep

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
A 25-year-old married mother of two, Scovia lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For five years she has been trading in clothes, mainly selling to men and women, and earns additional income from a cocoa business. Her main challenges are increasing transport costs and limited capital. 

Scovia has requested a loan of 700,000 shillings to buy more clothes to sell. She used her previous loan for the same purpose. 

Scovia hopes to expand her enterprise in the future into a renowned, fully-stocked boutique with the latest designs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old, married and supports a family of four children. 

David sells soft drinks, a business he has done for several years and it has been profitable. 

David has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES through VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy additional crates of sodas for resale. With the anticipated profits, David will be able to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to supply the surrounding area with milk for more income. 

His hopes and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional crates of sodas for resale

loans.name: Alexander Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre con 41 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes la cual situó en la sala de la casa donde reside. De allí se generan los ingresos mínimos para cubrir sus necesidades y apoyar económicamente a su hijo de 18 años en sus estudios.
Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su tienda con productos de la canasta familiar, de aseo personal y otros.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado no es el mejor.
texts.en:
41-year old Rafael opened his store a short while ago. He sells groceries from a room in his house, and with the small amount of money he earns he covers the cost household necessities and helps his 18-year old son pay for his education.

Rafael works seven hours daily. He is now seeking a loan to buy basic supplies for his store, personal hygiene items etc.

His dream is to improve the condition of his house as it has been deteriorating for some time and it is not in the best of states.
.

loans.use: buy stock for his store such as basic supplies, personal hygiene products, etc.

loans.name: Shahmim

texts.en:
Shahmim is a 47-year-old, married woman shown in the photo with her daughter. She is been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.

Through her high quality services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. That is why she has applied a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to service more customers and earn profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to provide service to more customers and earn profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Manabhangi

texts.en:
Manabhangi, 35, is from Sambalpur district, Odisha, India. She has a small and contented family comprising of her only son and her husband who is a mason by profession. Manabhangi owns a food stall near her house and has a very good reputation in her community, as she serves healthy and tasty food to her customers. Unfortunately, she lacks a latrine in her home and faces a lot of difficulties to go outside for urination and defecation.

Manabhangi is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet and incorporate sanitary fittings for it so as to increase the convenience for her family. She has a dream of opening an air conditioned restaurant in the future and serve a larger customer base, and gain name and fame.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate sanitary fittings.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохире 40 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать двоих детей. Мохира трудолюбивая и гостеприимная женщина. Она около 12 лет занимается земледелием.
   В этом году Мохира посадила кукурузу и люцерны. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Мохире надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. У Мохиры есть план, которая  хочет посадить зелень для расширения бизнеса. Для посадки зелень необходим парник. Она запрашивает кредит для купли минеральных удобрений, и  материалы для парника у Мохиры нет денег. Она верит, что Вы внесете вклад в получение урожая. Она верит в Вас и Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mohira is 40 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. Mohira is a hard-working and hospitable woman. She has been growing crops for about twelve years.

This year Mohira has planted corn and alfalfa. Only a little time remains until harvest. At the present time Mohira needs to treat her crop with mineral fertilizer. She plans to get a high quality and rich harvest, and so she wants to buy good quality, proven fertilizer. Mohira has a plan according to which she will plant herbs to expand her business. A greenhouse is essential for planting herbs. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and materials for a greenhouse because Mohira has no money. She believes that you will contribute to getting her harvest. She believes in you and in your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and materials for a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ingenzi Group

texts.en:
Ingenzi is a group led by Deliphine, who is 32 years old. The group name means “important people” in English. She is married with two children, aged 7 and 9 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing a business for the past five years.

The group members sell different items, and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Deliphine would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old, married, and supports a family of two children. 

She has been selling farm supplies for the last ten years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Rose has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production as well as add stock of fresh fruits for resale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production as well as add stock of fresh fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of coal for resale as well as a dairy cow so she can produce milk and supply it in her local area to get more income

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a mother of three children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in the buying and selling of eggs. She gets additional income from selling yellow bananas locally known as gonja.

She started the business to raise money to pay school fees for her children. She works hard and has plans to expand the eggs business, but she lacks enough capital. Sharifa is requesting a loan to buy eggs for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy eggs for selling to her customers

loans.name: Karpura

texts.en:
Karpura, 31, hails from a small village in Sambalpur district. She has a small family, which is comprised of her husband who is a farmer by profession and a son and a daughter who are in school. Karpura owns a poultry farm and looks after the chickens and raises them. She also looks after the household work and takes care of her family. Karpura is lacking a toilet in her home so her family uses the commercial toilet and has to walk for sometime before getting access to one.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes to improve health and hygiene in her family .This will help her to protct her family from harmful diseases and promote cleanliness.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel took a loan of $1,000 in TRM for the purchase of school equipment such as clothing, books, and pay registration fee. 

Abel is very excited because these loans are very helpful for the school.

loans.use: to buy clothing, books, and pay for the registration fee

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven, aged 38 years, is married with 6 children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years. He does coffee trading as his major source of income.

He has applied for a loan of shs 1,000,000 (One million shillings only) to buy coffee for trading.

He started business in the year 1995 with high hopes of earning income to cater for his family needs. He also does a saloon business to supplement his monthly income. His business is located in a rural area witin Bushenyi District and his clients are coffee traders.

He is a hard working man who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week in order to maximise profit. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations but has learned to manage it. He hopes to become financially stable and expand his business in future. He appreciates the UGAFODE- kiva partnership that that has helped to support the small enterpreneurs in growing their businesses.

loans.use: To boost his coffee trade business by buying coffee for trade

loans.name: Washila

texts.en:
Washila is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children. Some years ago she started her business of selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing a prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es: Luz tiene 26 años de edad, esta soltera y trabaja en una lavandería, de esa manera logra obtener sus propios ingresos y poder estudiar en la Universidad la carrera profesional de Derecho donde ya está por el IV ciclo de la carrera. El préstamo lo utilizara para pagar las cuotas (pension) de la Universidad para así ya no tener que preocuparse y dedicarse a estudiar para obtener las mejores calificaciones. Su plan a futuro es culminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y obtener su título profesional para poder trabajar y también implementar su propio estudio jurídico. Luz está muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo y confianza que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Luz is 26 years old, single, and works in a laundromat. In this way, she is able to earn her own income and to study law in university, where she already is in her fourth year.

She will use the loan to pay the university "cuotas" (fees) so that she doesn't have to worry and can devote herself to studying to get the best grades. Her plan for the future is to satisfactorily finish her degree and obtain her professional qualification in order to work and to start her own practice.

Luz is very content and happy with the investors of KIVA for the support and confidence that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and cassava for sale

loans.name: Abadahemuka Sub Group B

texts.en:
Annoncithe is a group leader; aged 60 years. She is married, with 4 children aged between 17 and 20 years.

The group is called ABADAHEMUKA, meaning “TRUSTED PEOPLE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to achieve a better future.

She has a shop and has been running a business for 10 years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Wangjing Bazar Phiyonbi Lup Group

texts.en:
Devarani is a cloth vendor by profession. She started her own business with a small capital in order to support her family expenses. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw and his income was not enough to maintain the family expenses.

Her monthly income was only 4,800 INR per month. She now sees scope to expand her business and contribute more towards the household financially. Thus, she has come forward to apply for a loan. She will sell clothes like t-shirts, jeans, pants, shawls, etc. She expects her income to increase by 2,700 INR. 

Devarani leads a group of six women. The other remaining members of the group also engage in income-generating activities. So, they decided to form a group and apply for a loan of 72,000 INR (12,000 INR per member). After availing themselves of a loan, they hope to earn up to 270 INR per day as profit. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to expand her cloth business and sell t-shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is married to Orlando, a driver, and they live in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with their children. She raises hogs in their backyard to support and maintain their daily household needs. She also aims to save some amount of money in case of emergencies because she has no medical benefits and insurance as a self-employed worker.

Common illnesses of hogs attack during rainy season. Celia wants to prepare early to avoid those illnesses. She will buy medicine, vitamins, additional feed, and additional piglets. She is appealing for 20,000 PHP to procure all these. She aims to distribute a bigger volume of affordable pork within the community, and this financial assistance will be very helpful. She’s looking forward to having a permanent space in the market so customers can easily locate her. She’s happy to contribute to food production and distribution in their area.

Celia aspires to have her house renovated and visit beautiful places in the Philippines. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a hardworking 30-year-old woman who has three children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Sobia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Sobia has requested a loan amount 35,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for the prosperous future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Emelisa

texts.en:
This young entrepreneur is Emelisa, 26, from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She is married to Michael John, a 38-year-old farmer, and they have children. In addition to paying the fees for her children in school, Emelisa works hard to cover the household’s daily expenses.

Emelisa operates a “sari-sari” store, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and not surprisingly the competition is stiff. Somehow she tries to compete by retailing cellphone load.

To enhance her variety store and make it more competitive, Emelisa is applying for a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sachets and packs of toiletries, and many others. Part of it will be used to buy load wallet for her cellphone e-loading. This supplementary capital will make her business more stable and will give her higher income. In due time, she plans to add another income generating venture, something that can contribute to food production in her community, maybe more crops in their farm.

She wants her children to get a college education to bring them better opportunities in life. She thanks God and you in advance for this financial assistance, for it will surely bring supplementary income for the family.

All CCT community clients such as Emelisa are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба молодая девушка из городка Вахдат. Ей 38 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать двоих детей. Матлуба работает учительницей рисования в школе и в свободное время занимается шитьем. Матлуба хочет сделать ремонт в доме, но достаточно денег не имеет, чтобы купить стройматериалы. Она общается за кредитом, чтобы здесь ей помогли. Спасибо.
texts.en: Matluba is a young woman from the town of Vahdat. She is 38 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. Matluba works as a drawing teacher in a school and in her spare time she sews. Matluba wants to renovate her house, but she does not have enough money to buy construction materials. She is applying for a loan so people here can help her. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house.

loans.name: Aludia

texts.en:
Aludia  is a hard-working woman from Getafe. She has been raising hogs to earn a living for 19 years now. She is requesting a loan as additional capital to buy feed for her hogs and food, water and clothes for her family. Aludia wish to make her business a success. She would like to improve her business so that she can make the most out of her profit and support her five children ages 13 to 19.

In the future, she hope to renovate her house and live in comfort from profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and food, water and clothes for her family

loans.name: Maria Luna

texts.en:
This is Maria Luna from the beautiful town of Polomolok, South Cotabato. She is married to Melchor, a farmer, and they have three children: one in college, one in high school, and one in elementary level. Maria Luna’s husband is not only her life partner but also her business buddy. Both of them strive hard to enhance their “sari-sari” or variety store business. Melchor also nurtures an asparagus plantation for added income. Asparagus is a high priced, very nutritious vegetable, which is good for soup, salad and pasta. The couple is geared towards one direction – to have a happy family living at their own house, with sufficient resources, viable businesses, and successful careers for their children. Maria Luna wants to take another step towards this dream by borrowing capital worth PHP 18,000. She will buy more supplies for her variety store to meet the demand of customers. She knows that she can earn higher income with enhanced capital. Subsequently, she can set aside more savings for their children’s education.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer con 20 años de edad, que desde hace poco monto su propio negocio, una tienda la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside. Con esto ha logrado superar una difícil situación económica  la cual vivió luego de que su pareja se quedara sin empleo por unos meses.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el fin de abastecer su negocio con productos de aseo personal, de la canasta familiar y otros.
Su mayor sueño es poder pagarla la educación a sus hijos, pues son el motor que impulsa a esta mujer para seguir luchando.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Paola is a 20 year old woman who recently opened her own business, a shop which is located in the house where she lives. With it, she has managed to overcome a difficult economic situation in which she lived after her partner remained unemployed for several months.

She is seeking a loan in order to stock her business with personal hygiene products, basic staple goods, and other items.

Her biggest dream to to be able to pay for her children's education, since they are the driving force that motivates this woman to continue fighting. For this, she counts on the help of Interactuar and the contributors of Kiva.

loans.use: to stock her business with personal hygiene products, basic staple goods, and other items.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Humberto es un hombre de 62 años de edad, un trabajador de calle incansable, que sale diariamente a recorrer las calles de Medellín empunando su carro de productos alimenticios. 

Humberto lleva realizando esta actividad por 15 largos daños, ya que tiempo antes trataba de emplearse pero le negaron la posibilidad y encontró en el emprendimiento una manera de generar recursos para su familia y hoy en día sigue con la actividad que le da el capital suficiente para llevar el alimento a su casa.

Es un hombre separado, pero tiene 4 hijos. Este sorprendente personaje, trabaja de lunes a viernes 15 horas.

En busca de sostenimiento y seguir desarrollando su actividad, Humberto quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos fritos, dulces y golosinas.
texts.en:
Humberto is a 62-year-old man who works non-stop, who goes out daily through the streets of Medellín with his snack cart.

Humberto has done this for 15 long years, considering that before he tried to find a job but was denied that possibility and found in the business venture a way to generate resources for his family. Today, he continues because it gives him enough money to bring home food.

He is separated, but has four children. He is an admirable person, working Monday to Friday 15 hours.

In search of sustaining support and continuing to develop his activity, Humberto wants to request a loan to buy fried products, snacks, and sweets.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fried products, snacks, and sweets to stock his cart.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie runs this variety store located in front of their house in Polomolok, South Cotabato. It has significantly progressed in her 15 years of operation. She started by selling basic commodities like sachets of shampoo and biscuits, and now she offers rice. Aside from this, she was able to add another enterprise which is baking cakes. She’s paying three workers to help her in these enterprises. But Rosemarie doesn’t stop dreaming. She still aspires to expand not only to boost her income and savings, but also to help her neighbors earn a living. She chooses to employ those who are hard working but have no chance to land a stable job. 

To develop her business further, she is requesting an additional capital worth PHP 50,000. She plans to buy additional stock for her store and necessary ingredients for baking cakes. This will further strengthen her business and uphold the salaries of her workers.

Rosemarie is married to Roland, an overseas Filipino worker. Both of them wish that their children will continue developing the business someday. 

Rosemarie is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store and ingredients for baking cakes

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
From Polomolok, South Cotabato, here is Eulalia, a 60-year-old widow who doesn’t want to be brought down by loneliness and loss. Instead, she keeps focusing on how to grow her variety store business. It sells commodities like toiletries, biscuits and candies, canned goods, and beverages. She includes rice, charcoal and cellphone e-loading to augment her income. Her business gives her a sense of productivity and self-confidence that she can get through all obstacles in life.

Now she is applying for PHP 60,000 loan mainly to buy more grocery items and beverages, sacks of rice and charcoal, and load wallet for cellphone e-loading. Your assistance will be gratefully appreciated by a widow like her. She has to save for emergency cases because she no retirement benefits or health insurance as a self-employed worker. 

She draws strength and inspiration from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who meet every week to share life experiences and reflect on the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and beverages, sacks of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Leuy's Group

texts.en:
Leuy is 63 years old, a mother of five children and lives in Pursat province,  She grows rice to earn income to support her family. She earns additional income from pig-raising. Her rice has not grown well and her pigs got ill, which have been the main challenges for her family. She has been involved in her current businesses for 45 years and she can save about 14,600 KHR per day from her income.
Due to a lack of working capital, she is now leading a group of four to borrow for her first time from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her rice farm can produce a high yield with good income for her to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mehrobsho

texts.ru: Молодой самостоятельный, заботливый парень из города Турсунзаде, Мехробшо. Ему всего 20 лет. Его мама домохозяйка, а отец находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Мехробшо решил остатся с мамой и позаботится о ней. Он после окончании школы начал заниматься таксистом, и помочь людьям. Мехробшо  с утра до вечера перевозить людей.  Вот так он зарабатывает на жизнь, доход от такси обеспечить его и маму. На данный момент его машина находится на мастерской. Мехробшо нужен для для ремонта автомашин. Без машины он не может зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Он обратился кредитом, чтобы поченить машину. Мехробшо надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mehrobsho is an independent, caring young man from the town of Tursun-zoda. His is just 20 years old. His mother is a homemaker, and his father is away working in the Russian Federation. Mehrobsho decided to stay with his mother and look after her. After graduating from school he began working as a taxi driver and helping people. Mehrobsho drives people around from morning to night. This is how he earns a living. The income from his taxi provides for him and his mother. At the present time his car is in the repair shop. Mehrobsho needs money to repair his car. Without a car he is not able to earn and provide for his family. He has applied for a loan in order to fix his car. Mehrobsho hopes for your support.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Shakila  is 42 years old, married, and has run a business buying and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Shakila has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use the loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio tiene 43 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la producción de café desde hace más de 25 años de experiencia en la producción de café, está casado con Reina Leticia, Julio y Leticia tienen 5 hijos bajo su cargo, Julio y su esposa se esfuerzan a diario para darles a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan. Su sueño conjunto es verlos a todos convertidos en personas de bien y que tengan las oportunidades que ellos no han tenido. 
Julio actualmente está interesado en una práctica de producción que se ha hecho muy popular en la zona y es la producción de café orgánico, esta práctica permite producir café de mayor calidad y por ende vender a mejores precios, hace las fincas más sostenibles, cuida de los suelos y no contamina el medio ambiente.
Julio solicita un crédito para iniciar el proceso de conversión a producción orgánica de su cafetal para lo que ha decidido replantar e iniciar el proceso con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido Julio tendrá los suficientes ingresos para que a sus hijos no les falte nada. 
Un préstamo ayudara a Julio a replantar y a certificar su cafetal el certificado le ayudará a vender su café a mejores precios, cuidar el medio ambiente y darles sus hijos oportunidades para su futuro.
texts.en:
Julio is 42 years old; he works in farming, especially in coffee production, where he has over 25 years of experience. He is married to Reina Leticia; Julio and Leticia have five children in their care. Julio and his wife work hard every day to give their children everything they need. Their dream is to see them become good people and have the opportunities they never had.

Julio is currently interested in a growing technique that has become very popular in the area, which is growing organic coffee. This technique results in better quality coffee, which can be sold at higher prices; it makes the farms more sustainable; it protects the soil and does not contaminate the environment.

Julio is requesting a loan to start the process of converting to organic farming in his coffee plantation, which is why he has decided to replant and start the process over with completely new crops. With the earnings he makes from selling his organic coffee, Julio will have enough income that his children will want for nothing.

A loan will help Julio replant and certify his coffee plantation; the certification will help him sell his coffee at better prices, care for the environment, and give his children opportunities for their future.

loans.use: to buy organic products such as: insecticides, fertilizers, and pesticides needed to carry out the process of converting to organic growing on his coffee plantation

loans.name: Guzalhon

texts.ru:
39-летняя Гузалхон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. У нее прекрасная семья: любимый муж и 3 дочери. Ее муж находится загранице, по причине, что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Сама Гузалхон обладает мастерством кройки и шитья. Уже на протяжении 5 лет она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. Гузалхон любит свою деятельность и хорошо справляется с ней. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может делать работу по домашнему хозяйству.  
В данный момент Гузалхон хочет купить современную компьютерную швейную машинку, потому что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо.  Она видит, что ей не хватает еще немного средств для покупки желаемую машинку. Ваша поддержка ей сейчас очень важна.
texts.en:
39-year-old Guzalhon lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She has a wonderful family: a beloved husband and three daughters. Her husband is abroad because he was not able to find suitable work in his country. Guzalhon herself is an expert in cutting and sewing. She has been sewing women's dresses in the national style for the past five years. Guzalhon loves her work and does it well. In her words, it is convenient for her to sew at home since she can additionally do housework.

At the present time Guzalhon wants to buy a modern computerized sewing machine because her current machine does not function sufficiently well. She sees that she just needs a little more money to buy the machine she wants. Your support now is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy a modern computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза красивая  жительница района Шахринав. Ей 21 лет. Она не замужем  и не имеет детей. Фируза  живет с мамой, отцом и сестрой.  Четыре года назад Фируза решила начать новый бизнес, чтобы помогать родителям обеспечить семью. Она начала изучать профессию швеи, чтобы зарабатывать таким путем для улучшения условий жизни семьи. Фируза быстро освоила  эту деятельность. Ей сейчас в работе помогает сестра. Фируза берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку и необходимые ткани материалы для шитья женской одежды. Фируза верит в Вас и ожидает поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Firuza is a beautiful resident of the Shahrinav region. She is 21 years old. She is unmarried and has no children. Firuza lives with her mother, father and sister. Firuza decided to start a new business four years ago in order to help her parents to provide for the family. She began studying the profession of a seamstress in order to earn money and thus to improve her family's living conditions. Firuza quickly mastered this activity. Now her sister helps her with her work. Firuza is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine and essential fabrics and materials for sewing women's clothing. Firuza believes in you and looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and essential sewing materials.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
This is Estrellita, a 59-year-old widow from Ulas, Davao City. She is busy with her “sari-sari” or variety store that sells the usual commodities. She also has a coin-operated Internet computer called PisoNet that provides affordable internet for short-time users. She tries all possible ways to enhance her business because it supplies the resources to meet her daily needs. It’s just good that her grown-up children are no longer dependent on her. Yet, she still desires to earn money herself since she understands that her children are starting their own families too. 

She applied for PHP 29,000 in supplementary capital that she will use partly to buy sacks of rice, grocery items and beverages for her store. She would like to set aside some amount as seed money to build extension rooms that she can rent out as a boarding house. Her income from this will hopefully ensure her needs as she gets older.
 
Estrellita is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, grocery items and beverages for her store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 41 years old and married with two children, both in school.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a cafeteria and farming rice.

Analyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una señora soltera con 42 años de edad, con 2 hijos menores los cuales adora con toda su alma.  Ella monto su propio negocio, una sala de belleza la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside.
De allí obtiene los recursos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara productos capilares, tratamientos, una plancha y secador de cabello.
Su deseo es llegara abrir su primer local y lograr generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.

Sueña con ver su casa bonita, ya que esta lleva muchos años de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, contribuya con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Angélica is a single woman who is 42 and has two children whom she loves with all her heart. She started her own business, a beauty salon that is located in the living room of her home.

It generates the income she needs to provide the necessities her home deserves.

She is requesting a loan to buy hair products, treatments, a flat iron, and a hair dryer.

Her goal is to open her own shop and be able to provide employment for the people who need it most.

She dreams of seeing her house look nice, as it was built many years ago and is not currently in the best shape.

You can be a part of this dream: contribute with a loan.

loans.use: to buy hair products, treatments, a flat iron, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize seeds for planting and for poshomill

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 38-year-old married woman who runs a small boutique at home in order to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices and then sews garments which she sells to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

For the improvement of her business, Sakeena has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors so she can consistently meet her customers’ demands, increase her net income, and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors so she can consistently meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Emiliano De Jesus

texts.es:
En el año 2011, inicio su vida como independiente el señor Emiliano, un hombre, tierno, trabajador, que busca por todos los medios ganarse el sustento para su familia, conformada por 4 hijos y su pareja.

Actualmente Emiliano se dedica a vender gafas en unidades y al por mayor en las calles del centro de Medellín.

El sueño de este hombre de 59 años de edad es comprar una vivienda, para ello tiene que convertirse en todo un empresario y buscar la forma de como ampliarse y conseguir un local comercial que le permitan atraer un excelente volumen de clientes.

Emiliano quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de gafas, monturas, lentes al por mayor, buscando diversificar y refrescar su ofertar a los clientes.
texts.en:
Affectionate, hard-working Emiliano started his life as an independent man in 2011. He searches for every opportunity to support his family, made up of his 4 children and his wife.

Currently, Emiliano makes a living by selling glasses individually and wholesale in the streets of downtown Medellín.

The dream of this 59-year-old man is to buy a house. To do this, he needs to become a great businessman and search out a way to apply himself and find a location for a store, which will allow him to attract an excellent number of customers.

Emiliano wants to request a loan to purchase glasses, frames, and lenses wholesale, hoping to diversify and refresh his offerings for the customers.

loans.use: to buy glasses, frames, and lenses in large quantities. He wants to update his sales catalog for his customers.

loans.name: Borey's Group

texts.en:
Borey, 21, is a young mother of one child living in Kratie Province. She earns income to support her family by growing cassava. She also works as a laborer for others to earn extra income. Her cassava has not grown well, so she sells it for a low price.

This is Borey's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her previous loan. She used her previous loan to improve her living conditions so they are better than before. In this group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and organic pesticide to put on her farmland to get higher yields. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and organic pesticide to put on her farmland to get higher yields.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena es una madre cabeza de familia de 46 años de edad, una persona pujante, verraca, trabajadora, la cual no se deja vencer antes las adversidades y con su entusiasmo y capacidad de liderazgo ha logrado sortear los obstáculos que la vida le ha puesto.

Se separó de su esposo y quedó a cargo de sus tres pequeños los cuales tienen 11, 13  y 6 años de edad, su propósito es pagar su educación y tener un hogar sólido, estable, donde no carezcan de necesidades.

Luz Elena para generar recursos tiene una tienda de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, la cual quiere darle un empuje, surtiéndola con productos de los cuales carece, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y licores, los cuales le ayudarán a captar un importante número de clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is a mother, 46 years old. She is thriving, resourceful, and hardworking and doesn't give up when confronted with adversity. With her enthusiasm and capacity for leadership, she has been able to overcome the obstacles that life has thrown her way.

She separated from her husband and found herself in charge of her three children, ages 11, 13, and 16 years old. Her goals are to pay for their education and to have a solid, stable home where they won't lack any necessities.

In order to earn an income, Luz Elena opened a small grocery store, which she wants to grow by stocking it with products she currently lacks. For this reason she is requesting a loan, so she can buy grocery items and liquors, which will help her bring in a good number of customers.

loans.use: buy grocery items and liquors, which will help her bring in a good number of customers.

loans.name: Sayramhon

texts.en: Sayramhon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1953. She  lives in small city with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband works in security. He works at a hospital. She has 30 years of work experience. She works at an ambulance. She is a well and trusted client at IMON and does her repayments on time. She is a responsible, honest, hardworking and patient person. She felt bad and decided to be tested at the hospital. Her analysis was not so good and the doctors recommended staying at the hospital to heal. She applied to IMON and Kiva asking for financial support to pay for her treatment at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at the hospital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with seven children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a shop with a variety of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 47 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Telavi. Mariam is unemployed and decided to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of GEL 1,500 to start up a new business. With the received credit she will trade fruits and vegetables. Mariam is very hardworking woman and is very motivated to run her own business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia  is 55 years old and married that has run a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 2 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn more income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn more income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita was young when she lost her husband. She raised her daughter Zara alone due to her hard and tireless work.
Rita bakes different cookies in her house and sells to local food markets. Due to her nice attitude and very tasty cookies, she receives many orders from her partner shops and its' customers.
Rita's small but sustainable business now needs some help: she asks lenders to support her financially to purchase a refrigerator and oven, as well as to purchase materials for making different types of cookies.
Rita has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and oven, as well as to purchase materials for making different types of cookies.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 41 years old and married. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases varieties of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Shahnaz has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home, as her husband’s income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Fatima is popularly known in her area for her skills in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 30-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade that was imposed by the Israeli authorities in 2007. He is a father of two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mahdi also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Mahdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Mahdi can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot! Mahdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man with three children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 31 years old.

She is married and they have one child. She does farming and poultry keeping.

She has been keeping poultry for one year. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her child and reinvest in the business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful poultry farmer.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Mrisa

texts.en:
