Mrisa is a married man and he has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to have a big grocery store within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 39, lives with family members in a rural village of Siem Reap province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young to attend school. She earns income to improve her family’s living via working as a massager. This is Mom's third loan cycle and she has fully paid back her past loans. Those loans helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading a group to apply for a new loan to buy a decent motorbike. She will use this to drive to work on time and save on her daily transportation cost. She hopes that this loan will help her to go to work on time and save more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive to work on time and save on the cost of daily transportation.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Azmi

texts.en:
Azmi is a 44-year-old married man from Gaza city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He is a father of two sons and two daughters. Azmi has an auto mechanic shop. It is a good business and makes a good profit as he has loyal customers.

Azmi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his auto repair garage. With this loan, Azmi can expand his garage and improve his service. Azmi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his auto repair garage.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is 35 years old. She is a single mother of 3 school-going children. She sells used clothing and has been in this business for one year.

This is Benedetta's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this loan to purchase more stock of clothing to sell. She will use the profits from her business to educate her children and purchase food for her family.

Benedetta's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow and stabilize her business so it can generate her sufficient income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a widowed woman with two children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells milk, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, soap and other items.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is involved in making needlework carpets, silk tablecloths and a number of other compositions. She makes and sells them from her own house in Noyemberyan town. Narine asks for this loan to purchase new stock (fabric paintings, fibers, jewelry) for production and sale of carpets and different tablecloths.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Narine will be very thankful to lenders for their support, because this loan is very important for her business to develop further.

loans.use: to pay for new stock (fabric paintings, fibers, jewelry) to make different carpets, and tablecloths to sell.
